loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Carlos de 52 años de edad viven casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up desde hace 10 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Carlos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is 52 years old. He lives in his own house with his wife. He has worked making trips in his pick up for 10 years. He has a lot of customers who prefer him because he is responsible when he is driving. With what he earns from his work he covers his household expenses. Carlos is asking for a loan to buy tires and do maintenance on his vehicle because it is his only source of work. This way, he can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es:
José de 51 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja es ama de casa le acompaña en las actividades con las que generan los ingreso en el hogar.

José es agricultor, aprendió de sus abuelos a trabajar la tierra en granos básicos, los fines de semana tienen un negocio en el que vende comida con su pareja y eventualmente trabaja como panadero. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar un horno de tipo industrial para la elaboración de pan y comprar productos de canasta básica y primera necesidad para iniciar una tienda.

José se proyecta comprar una motocicleta para salir a vender pan en la comunidad y en las comunidades vecinas.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old and has 2 children. He has a partner who is a housewife and helps him with the work from which they generate their household income.

José is a farmer, having learned from his grandparents how to work the land to grow basic grains and pulses. At the weekends he has a business where he sells food with his partner, and occasionally works as a baker.

He needs the loan to buy an industrial oven to make bread, and to buy basic staple products to start a shop.

José plans on buying a motorcycle in the future so he can go out to sell bread in the local and neighbouring communities.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to make bread, and to buy basic staple products to start a shop.

loans.name: Jinja Progressive School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Swaibu. He is the Director of Jinja Progressive Secondary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Jinja town with 2500 students. Jinja Progressive Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school requires two systems due to the high population; one will be installed in the dining hall and another in the boy’s dormitory. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jinja Progressive Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Swaibu ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase two water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Jinja Ss School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joshua. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Jinja Secondary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Jinja with 4500 students. Jinja Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school requires two systems due to the high population; one will be installed in the dining hall and another in the boy’s dormitory.The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jinja Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joshua ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase two water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Ana Emelinda

texts.es: Ana de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner and three children. She has made and sold tortillas from home for many years and she has many customers. 

Ana is applying for a loan to buy quintals of corn and limes to continue making tortillas so that she can generate more income which will lead to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and limes

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 47 years old and has chosen to be single. She lives in a rural community with her mother. She has owned and managed a small retail store for more than one year. She aims to further improve her business and generate a higher income to meet their necessities and save some for future emergencies. 

Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access an additional PHP20,000 to buy more snack foods, assorted candies, noodles, detergent soaps, beverages and soft drinks to resell. Having this financial assistance, she believes that she will increase her inventory of grocery items and satisfy her customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods, assorted candies, noodles, detergent soaps, beverages and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nhoma 02 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Nhân works in agriculture raising pigs. She  is applying for a loan to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future. 

Nhân is 28 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the Nhoma 02 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu solidarity group. 

In 2013, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nhân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nhân has been involved in this business for nine years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In future, Nhân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 52 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase gasoline, fishing net, etc.

Charina has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future, Charina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, fishing net, etc

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 46-year-old woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family, consisting of seven children as well as she can. She is a widow so her son has been running a restaurant for the last many years. He provides service to people by providing good and fresh meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Lots of shopkeepers come into his restaurant to eat delicious food. 

Balqees' son needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Balqees contacted Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Balqees for the development of her son's restaurant business. 

Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her son's restaurant business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 54 years old, married, and has five children. With one child still in school, Angelina works very hard to provide for them.

Angelina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cereals, noodles, canned goods, bread, biscuits, etc. 

Angelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, cereals, noodles, canned goods, bread, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries like shampoo, cereals, noodles, canned goods, bread, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu Group

texts.en:
Hòng is 46 years old, married, and has two children. Hòng is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 03 Quảng Lưu solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

Hòng works in agriculture, raising pigs. Hòng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2013,  Hòng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hòng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In the future, Hòng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 50-year-old man married to Angeline, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children.  

Kennedy has been operating a restaurant and a pub as a secondary business for a period of two years, earning himself an income of KES 25,000 at the end of every month.

Kennedy is now servicing his third loan of KES 60,000 with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use this amount to buy cooking fat, wheat flour, rice, maize flour and soft drinks to add to the current stock.

Kennedy plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice, maize and wheat flour to add to his restaurant stock.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is 44 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Anna Liza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anna Liza requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Anna Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's mason work.

loans.name: Leony

texts.en:
Leony works hard to support her family. She is married and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business. 

She has been in this business for 19 years now.

In the future, Leony would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Bawoumadom

texts.fr: Commerçante de charbon de bois, BAWOUMADOM est veuve et mère de trois enfants et âgée de 42ans ; elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché d’Anié et vend à domicile, mais loge au quartier Agoè dans une maison dont la latrine est traditionnelle et ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement avec un niveau primaire. Ayant cette lourde responsabilité de prendre soin seule de ses enfants et dans le souci de subvenir aux besoins qui lui font face, BAWOUMADOM désire un crédit pour pouvoir mieux vendre afin de  faire face à toutes éventualités.
texts.en:
Bawoumadom sells charcoal.  She is 42 years old, widowed and has three children.  She buys her stocks three times a month at the Anié market and then sells them from door-to-door.  

She lodges in the Agoè neighbourhood, in a house with a traditional latrine.  Bawoumadom cannot afford any means of transportation.  She is alone with the difficult task of taking care of her children.

Bawoumadom has requested this loan in order to sell more product and provide more for the needs of her children.  She wants to be able to respond to any situation that arises for her family.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Moyo Wa Upendo Grp Musoma Group

texts.en:
Koti, who is in his early 30s, is married and has two children who are still in school.  

He has been buying and transporting fish upcountry for ten years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Koti's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more fish, which he sent upcountry. He has paid back his loan successfully. He is doing great with the loan. He used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy more fish for transporting upcountry. He dreams of being an international fish seller.

Koti will share this loan with his loan group "Moyo Wa Upendo Grp Musoma," which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish for transporting upcountry.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Thôn Bắc -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Yến is 25 years old, and she is married with two children. She operates a food stall selling fish. Yến has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Yến faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 13 Thôn Bắc -Quảng Nham  solidarity group. Yến is applying for a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

In 2012, Yến joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Yến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hương is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the Nhóm 09 Mỹ Điền Đa Lộc solidarity group. 

Hương works in agriculture, raising poultry. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is lack of capital.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Nhóm 13- Thôn Trung - Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Thu is 22 years old; she is married with one child.

Mrs.Thu operates a food stall selling fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.

This is Thu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women; she is the group leader of the Nhóm 13- Thôn Trung - Quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a 52 year old married woman and a mother of three grown up children, from Ajuy, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than three years. Her husband also works as a carpenter. 

Nimfa is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing boat, nets and lead weights. Nimfa believes that a loan could really help them improve their fishing business.

Nimfa hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new fishing boat, nets and lead weights

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 40 years old. He is married to Mildred and together they have been blessed with three children 14, 9 and 2 years old. Mildred is a teacher and hence provides additional income for her family.

Evans makes and sells furniture, a business he has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

Evans has requested his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 30,000, which he will use to purchase timber for making furniture.

With the anticipated profits, Evans will be able to build a house for his family as well as pay school fees for his children.
 
His hope for the future is to have a stable source of income and business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Temilda

texts.es: Almuerzos, frituras, pasteles y hayacas, son los principales productos que elabora Temilda, trabajando diariamente desde las 4 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, en su negocio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, donde habita con sus dos hijos de 16 y 21 años. Este negocio inició hace 6 años, aunque antes pertenecia a sus padres, quienes habian logrado su posicionamiento. Cuando el padre de Temilda  falleció, ella, su hermana y su madre, continuaron vendiendo caribañolas, bollos limpios, arepas, empanadas  en las horas de la mañana y al medio dia, empezaron a vender almuerzos.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado, a clientes ubicados  en su propio barrio,  a profesores, estudiantes de colegios vecinos y en tambien cuentan con clientes de los barrios que la circundan. Temilda siempre está pendiente de los eventos que ocurren a su alrededor, por eso ella es a quien primero avisan, porque logra captar la atención y la accion de compra para el desarrollo de eventos y actividades festivas y tambien tiene acceso fácil a los vendedores del centro de la ciudad  y especialmente a los del parque cultural de Barranquilla, quienes le compran constantemente.  Su meta es ampliar su negocio e incrementar el volumen de ventas, para aumentar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la actualidad Temilda está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financimeinto que hace a la Fundación mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales constructivos, con los cuales planea hacer adecuaciones a su patio, ampliando la posibilidad de incrementar su capacidad de atención al cliente, lugar que hará mejoras y ofrecerá como un sitio mucho mas confortable, mejorando así su presentación y el incremento de sus ventas, que es a lo que finalmente le apunta Temilda.
texts.en:
Lunches, “frituras” [fritters], cakes, and “hayacas” [beef, pork or chicken, and vegetables wrapped in cornmeal dough] are the main products that Temilda makes.  She works daily from 4:00 in the morning until 1:00 in the afternoon.  Her business is located south of the city where she lives with her children, ages 16 and 21.  She started this business six years ago, although previously it belonged to her parents, who strived to achieve its market position.  When Temilda’s father died, she, her sister, and her mother continued selling “carimañolas” [meat-stuffed fried yucca root], “bollos limpios” [white, dry corn wrapped in corn cob leaves and boiled or blanched], “arepas” [corn pancakes], “empanadas” [pastries filled with chopped or ground meat, vegetables, fruit, etc., and usually baked or fried] in the morning and began selling lunches at midday.  She makes her sales in cash, and sells to customers in her own neighborhood, teachers, school students, neighbors, and also has customers from the surrounding neighborhoods.  

Temilda is always aware of the events that are happening around her. People let her know first because she manages to draw the attention, and desire to buy during the development of events and festivals.  She also has easy access to the downtown vendors, especially those in the Barranquilla cultural park, who make purchases regularly.  Her goal is to expand her business and increase sales volume and thereby improve her family’s quality of life.   Currently, Temilda is applying for a Kiva loan, her first with “Fundación Mario Santo Domingo”.  She will use the funds to purchase construction materials, with which she plans to make adaptions to her patio, making it possible to serve more customers.  The improvements she will make to the place will permit her to offer a much more comfortable space, thus improving its appearance and increasing her sales, which is Temilda’s ultimate goal.  .

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to adapt her busines location.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man who has three children. He describes himself to be innovative. Julius operates a retail business where he sells drinks, flour, sugar and other items. He has been in business for 10 years. His business is located in an area favorable for business and his primary customers are locals. 

Julius describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more sugar, bread, milk, drinks and other items. 

His business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. In the future Julius hopes to improve his family's living standards and have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy sugar, bread, milk, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Agée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de six enfants, AWA est ménagère du riz mélangée à l’haricot et vend aussi de la bouillie faite à base du mil et par conséquence s’approvisionne trois fois par mois. Elle loge au quartier Agoè dans une maison où le toit est en tôle, avec une latrine traditionnelle, se nourrit deux fois par jour et dont le foyer ne dispose pas de moyen de déplacement. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle afin de pouvoir mieux économiser, AWA sollicite un prêt qui l’aidera à mieux s’entretenir.
texts.en:
Awa is 46 years old, married and has six children.  She makes and sells a mixture of rice and beans.  She also sells millet porridge.  She buys her stocks three times a month.

Awa lodges in the Agoè neighbourhood, in a house with a tin roof and a traditional latrine.  She eats twice a day and her household cannot afford any means of transportation.

Awa has requested this loan to help her to save money in her business and respond to the demands of her customers.  She hopes the loan will enable her to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of millet, 1 sack of rice and 7 bowls of beans for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, cane and other items

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Lộc Tiên,hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hường is 58 years old, and she is married and has three children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the Nhóm 11 Lộc Tiên,Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

Hường works in agriculture, raising poultry. Hường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is lack of capital.

In 2013, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In the future, Hường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: 030503010003.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Linh raises poultry. She is applying for a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Linh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Her main hardship is the lack of capital.

Linh is 49 years old, married with two children and this group's leader, which consists of four members.  She lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2005, Linh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid one loan.

With her business profits, Linh hopes her business will do well, to maintain a successful business and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stylish and new women's clothes

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 28 years old mother who runs a small retail store to help her family gain income. 

She wants to acquire more grocery items to sell but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP7,000.00 to buy more inventory of grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell. 

Having this financial assistance, Maricel believes she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items, fruits and vegetables to resell.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Adjara

texts.fr: ADJARA est mariée et mère de six enfants ; elle est âgée de 42 ans et habite le quartier Sorad à Agoè ; elle vend de la bouillie faite à base du mil et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché de d’Anié vers l’intérieur du pays. Le foyer d’ADJARA dispose d’un moyen de déplacement, mais elle n’a pas fréquenté et d’autre part dort du moins sous une moustiquaire. ADJARA sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son fréquence d’approvisionnement et participer d’une manière ou d’une autre aux charges du foyer, mieux épargner et gagner plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Adjara is 42 years old, married and has six children.  They live in the Sorad neighbourhood of Agoè.  She sells millet porridge and buys her stocks three times a month at the Anié market in the centre of the country.

Adjara's household has a means of transport but she did not have the opportunity to attend school.  She sleeps under a mosquito net.

Adjara has requested this loan in order to be able to replenish her stocks more frequently.  She hopes that she will be able to contribute to the costs of running her household, save some money and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of millet for her food production business.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Juillet 2014, est constitué de 25 membres qui habitent tous dans la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Aminata se trouvant assis a droite de la photo et levant le bras, est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un garçon de 22 ans et une fille de 24 ans.Elle est matrone a l’hôpital régional de kédougou et elle effectue en même temps le commerce.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 10 pompes a cheveux a 2500f l'une, 10 bracelets a 3500f l'un et 10 pairs de chaussures d'une valeur de 40000f.

avec son bénéfice,elle compte aider ses enfants dans leur scolarité et renforcer son épargne aussi.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2014 and is made up of 25 members who all live in the same area.  Their main business activity is commerce.

Aminata is sitting on the right of the photo, and has her hand raised.  She is the group representative.  She is married and mother to two children, a 22-year-old boy and a 24-year-old girl.  Aminata is a matron at the regional hospital in Kédougou, and, at the same time, she is involved in commerce.

She plans to use her loan to buy ten hair pumps for 2,500 francs CFA each, ten bracelets for 3,500 francs CFA each and ten pairs of shoes for a total of 40,000 francs CFA.  She will use her profits to help pay for her children's education and build up her savings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr: Le groupement SOPE NABY est composé de 6 personnes qui  sont toutes des femmes. Elles habitent ensemble dans le même quartier et se réunissent à chaque fois de besoin.  Elles ont comme présidente la dame AWA, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 55ans, elle évolue dans la commercialisation des tissus et des Wax et a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.  Elle demande ce montant de ce crédit pour acheter des tissus et ensuite les revendre à ses clients.  A l’avenir, elle souhaite diversifier son stock de marchandises et augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et cela elle ne pourra le faire que sous l’aide de l’institution.
texts.en:
The group called Sope Naby is composed of six persons, all of them women. They live in the same neighborhood and get together whenever there is need. Their president is Awa, the one who is raising her hand in the photo. 

Awa is married and the mother of her household. At 55 years of age, she has been selling cloth and "wax" print African cloth and has more than three years of experience in this business. She helps her husband cover their daily expenses and the school fees of her children. She is asking for this loan amount to buy lengths of cloth to resell to her clients. 

In future, she hopes to diversify her merchandise and grow her income so as to put aside savings and improve living conditions for her family. She will only be able to do that with the help of this institution.

loans.use: to buy cloth and "wax" African prints for resale

loans.name: Samanya

texts.en:
Samanya is a 45-year-old man married to Munken, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with eight children.  Samanya has been a livestock farmer for a period of five years, earning himself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.
  
Samanya is now servicing his third loan of KES. 50,000, and intends to use this amount to buy goats and cows for trading.

Samanya plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees to his children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy goats and cows for trading.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 53 years old and widowed with three children. With one child still in school, she works very hard to provide for her family.

Concepcion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase items like shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to resell.

Concepcion has been in business for 21 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, etc.
 
She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business.

Concepcion would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, soft-drinks, canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Nerlita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  

Nerlita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell for her buy and sell ready to wear business.

Nerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 29-year-old female, married, with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. Hellen is a tailor, mending clothes and making school uniforms for children. She has been in this business for two years. She has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. 

Hellen is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

Hellen is hardworking, and needs a loan to buy wrappers and materials for making suits and uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to buy wrappers and materials for making suits and uniforms

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 56 year old hardworking man with six children, living in Fort Portal Uganda.  He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes, maize and rice. 

Stephen faces challenges of limited capital; besides that, he has a goal to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. 

Stephen has asked for a loan to buy tomato herbicides to spray in his tomato garden.

loans.use: to buy tomato herbicides to spray in his tomato garden.

loans.name: Ndiaba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis novembre 2012.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village,elles sont liées par une responsabilité solidaire.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Oumou,habillée en jaune,à l'extrême droite sur la photo,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 03 garçons.Elle tient une boutique dans son village.

Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Ainsi,elle compte acheter de la marchandise pour une valeur de 75000f

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne à partir du bénéfice dégagé.
texts.en:
This group was created in November 2012.  It is made up of members who all come from the same village and are joined by a sense of community solidarity.  The women all work in commerce.

Oumou, dressed in yellow on the far right in the photo is the group representative.  She is married and has four children, three of her children are boys.  She runs a shop in her village, and has many years' experience.  Oumou plans to use her loan to buy merchandise to a value of 75,000 francs CFA.

Her aim is to increase her savings through increased profits.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to restock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la reparación de llantas desde hace 1 año, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad del trabajo que realiza y los buenos precios, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herramientas para reparación de llantas y cambiar las que actualmente posee ya que están bien deterioradas y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young man's face has been pixelated because he's 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area.

He has earned a living repairing tires for a year.  He has a lot of customers because of the quality of his work and his good prices.  He lives in his own house with his life companion.

He's requesting a loan to buy tools for repairing tires.  He has to change his current tools because they're very worn out.  That way he'll be able to continue with his job, which generates good profits.

loans.use: to buy tools for repairing tires

loans.name: 032005030001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huê has a retail business selling plastic goods. Huê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is 46 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more plastic goods to sell.

Huê is the group leader of the 032005030001.Yên Phong solidarity group, which consists of three members. This is Huê first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

The main hardship that Huê faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huê hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic goods

loans.name: 030911020003.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Quy has a retail business selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Her main hardship in her business is the lack of capital. Quy is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

She is 33 years old and she is married with three children..Quy is leader of the Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of three members. 
Quy lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents

In 2010, Quy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid one loan.

With her business profits, Quy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: 032001030002.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a retail business selling plastic goods. Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase plastic goods to sell.

Hương is 34 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

She is the leader of a three-member group, the 032001030002.Yên Phong solidarity group. 

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hương hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic goods to sell

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is 31 years old. She is married to Haron and together they have been blessed with three children of 13, 7 and 3 years of age. Haron provides additional income for his family.

Everlyne sells groceries, a business she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 8,500. 

Everlyne has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 15,000 which she will use to add more stock of groceries for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Everlyne will be able to repay her loan as well as improve her living standard. 

Her hope and dream for the future is to have a stable source of income, a business which will ensure her family's needs are catered for.

loans.use: to add more stock of groceries for resale

loans.name: 032004020001.yên Phong Group

texts.en:
Thanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling processed food. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell.

Thanh is 33 years old, and she is married with 2 children. She lives with two dependents in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 032004020001.Yên Phong solidarity group. In 2013, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es: Ana de 54 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has has a small store located in her place of residence for a number of years. She has many clients due to her good prices and the friendliness she displays in selling. She is requesting a loan to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc. in order to make more income to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old.  He lives with his parents in Gaza and sells electronics goods.  Mohammad has been involved in the retail business for many years. 

The goal of the loan is to buy construction tools, since its is important for him to mend damages and to pay for workers, due to the war in Gaza. Mohammad wants to rebuild his parent's kitchen, install doors and windows. He has shortage of money.

Mohammad wants to help his family and make their home better, which will enable them to live in with more psychologically comfort.  

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild after the war in Gaza.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan de 60 años de edad, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, por motivos de limitados recursos económicos, sus padres no lo pusieron a estudiar.

Juan es comerciante de ganado, tiene 20 años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio, compra ganada a las persona de su comunidad y él viaja con los animales al tiangue para luego venderlos, para ello camina cerca de 20 minutos; esta actividad la realiza 4 veces al mes, una vez por semana. Y mientras tanto se dedica a trabajar la tierra.

El préstamo era utilizado para comprar ganado, por el momento el precio del ganado ha bajado y quiere comprar para sacarlo a vender en la época que se pone más caro. Juan sueña con  hacer se unas cuanta cabezas de ganado para mantener siempre estable la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juan, 60, is married and his wife's a homemaker.  He didn't attend school because his parents had limited financial resources.

Juan sells livestock and has 20 years of experience in the business.  He buys livestock from people in his community and takes the animals to the market to sell them, walking about 20 minutes.  He does this four times a month, once a week.  In the meantime he earns a living farming.

The loan is for buying livestock.  At the moment the price has gone down, and he wants sell the livestock once the price goes up.

Juan dreams of getting a few head of livestock so sales in his business will always be stable.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 59 años de edad se dedica desde hace 12 años a la elaboración y venta de café, leche, te y panes con huevo, su negocio esta ubicado enfrente de una fabrica en una zona muy transitada y por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que vende logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar mas materia prima por mayo como: café, huevos, pan, leche, te, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 59 years old and for the last twelve years she has made and sold coffee, milk, tea and egg sandwiches. Her business is located in front of a factory in an area which sees a lot of foot traffic, which is why she has a lot of customers. Maria is able to meet some of her household costs from her sales. She lives in her own home with her husband. 

Maria is applying for a loan to buy more ingredients in bulk such as coffee, eggs, bread, milk, tea, etc. so that she can continue with her sales and make a higher profit.

loans.use: to buy coffee, eggs, bread, milk, tea, etc.

loans.name: José Wilfredo

texts.es:
José de 33 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 15 años de edad que están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad; por motivos de dificultades económicas y porque la escuela quedaba muy retirado, José solo estudio hasta 3° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa, solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es un productor agropecuario, cultiva granos básicos, tiene conocimientos de ganadería y actualmente creía cerdos, todo lo aprendió de su padre y de su abuelo cuando los acompañaba de pequeño en sus trabajos. Decidió dedicarse a este negocio por los buenos resultados que le ha dado hasta este momento. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar 3 cerdos de engorde y ganado de crianza, para desarrollarlos y llegado el punto venderlos. José sueña con tener buenas instalaciones para tener sus animales, comprar un vehículo para el traslado de  estos y para traer los sus alimentos.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old, is in a relationship and has two children, aged 10 and 5 years old. They are studying in the local school. José only studied until hie 3rd year of basic education due to economic considerations, plus the school was a long distance away. His wife is a housewife and only she and their children live with him.

José is a farmer. He grows basic grains and has knowledge about livestock and currently raises pigs. He learned this from his father and grandfather when he accompanied him to work when he was young. He decided to work in this field because of the good results that he has had up to now. The loan will be used to buy 3 pigs to fatten and cattle to raise them and when they are ready, sell them. José dreams of having good infrastructure to keep his animals and of buying a vehicle to transport them and to transport feed.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs to fatten and cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medical equipment and medicines for his a small clinic.

loans.name: Kopila Valley Children's School

texts.en:
The Kopila Valley School is an educational and community hub in Surkhet, Nepal – a region with 80% unemployment, very high dropout rates, chronic childhood malnutrition, and limited female participation in education and civil society. KVS’s ability to provide basic services is compromised by inefficient, expensive energy that is environmentally harmful. The loan will be used to install a 4kW solar energy system.

Maggie, an American student and volunteer, initially founded the school as an orphanage in 2006. Today KVS offers nursery to grade 9 schooling for more than 350 students, and is home to 44 children. (Children in the photos are the adopted children of the Kopila Valley Children's Home, and students from the surrounding villages who attend the Kopila Valley School.) In addition to offering some of the most innovative curriculum in the region, the school provides students with nutritious meals, medical and dental attention, and after school activities. 

The region lacks even the most basic emergency services and KVS frequently acts as a community center in crisis situations. During the August 2014 floods in the area, the school provided food, medical aid, and shelter to displaced people. 

The solar installation will be on KVS’s combined hostel and women’s training center. 50 vulnerable women reside at the hostel and the center trains approximately 60 women and girls each year. The center’s goal is to educate girls and women from Surkhet and neighboring villages in order to promote their economic self-sufficiency. Classes cover a range of topics including parenting, human rights, health, stress management, and self-confidence. The women spend much of their time on literacy, learning to read and write in both Nepali and English. They also learn vocational skills, including sewing, gardening, computer education, and entrepreneurship.

The Kopila Valley School is connected to a hydroelectric grid, but the staff, volunteers, and students must deal with daily power outages lasting as long as 18 hours a day.  Even when electricity is available, the voltage is only 160V rather than the 220V necessary to fully power the school’s equipment. As a result of this energy situation, students struggle to read or do their homework, staff are unable to do administrative work, it is difficult to prepare the student’s meals (which for many is their main meal of the day), and teachers and students cannot access electronic media devices, which are more and more essential to training. To compensate for uneven energy, KVS uses backup diesel, which is both expensive and environmentally damaging. 

Installing a solar energy system at Kopila Valley School will have environmental, social, and economic outcomes for the school and region.

loans.use: To pay for solar equipment that will provide reliable energy at the school.

loans.name: Jose Geremias

texts.es: Jose de 30 años de edad posee desde hace varios años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Jose vive con su madre, su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 30-year-old Jose has, for a number of years, run a shop in his home.  He has many customers because of his good prices and friendly demeanour when dealing with them. He lives in his own home with his mother and his three children. He is applying for a loan to buy soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc. so that he can boost his income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, vive con sus padres y su familia la conforma su hijo y su pareja.

María es comerciante,  todos los días trabaja en una venta de tortillas ubicada en el centro de la comunidad donde vive, cuando llega a su casa tiene ya preparada la venta de enchiladas, los fines de semana elabora pan para vender, tiene tres años trabajando de esta manera y se ha convertido en su fuente principal de ingresos.

EL préstamo será utilizado para comprar una cocina de plancha, actualmente tiene una pero está deteriorada y quiere iniciar una venta de pupusas. María espera le dé buenos resultados su proyecto para iniciar con otro negocio de venta de comida mejicana.
texts.en:
María, 25, has a live-in companion and a 3-year-old child.  She and her family--her son and her companion--live with her parents.

María's a merchant.  She works every day selling tortillas in the center of the town where she lives.  When she gets home, she already has prepared enchiladas for sale.  On the weekend she makes bread to sell.  She has worked this way for three years and it has become her main source of income.

The loan is to buy a kitchen grill.  The one she has now is worn out and she wants to start selling pupusas.

María hopes her project will yield good results so she can start another business selling Mexican food.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen grill

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es: Luis de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el posee una sastrería desde hace 11 años,  su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en: Luis is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. He has had a sewing workshop for the past 11 years. It is located in his place of residence. He has a lot of clients due to the quality of the clothing he makes. Luis is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc. to be able to continue with his work that generates good revenues for him.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Luis Aristides

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus abuelos, el se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 15 años, experiencia que le ha dado la oportunidad de vender una buena calidad de producto por esa razón posee clientes fijos, El esta solicitando un crédito ya que necesita comprar las herramientas necesarias para continuar con su trabajo como: trasmallos, redes y darle mantenimiento a la lancha, ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, lives in his own house with his grandparents.

He has earned a living in small-scale fishing for 15 years.  The experience has given him the opportunity to sell a good-quality product, so he has a lot of regular customers.

Luis is requesting a loan because he needs to buy the tools he needs to keep on working, such as trammel nets and nets, and to perform maintenance on his boat.  This is his only source of work and income.

loans.use: to buy trammel nets and nets, and to perform maintenance on his boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her boat's motor and to purchase two nets.

loans.name: Walter Edgardo

texts.es: Walter de 46 años de edad se dedica desde hace 6 años a la agricultura siembra maíz, frijol y hortalizas, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de la casa, vive con su esposa en casa propia, Walter está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que ha teneido buenos resultados con sus cultivos y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Walter is 46 years old and has been working in agriculture for six years. He plants corn, beans and vegetables. He sells his products around the area and with what he earns from these sales he is able to settle some of his household expenses. He and his wife live in their own house. Walter is requesting another loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land pictured in the photo. He has had good results with his farming and in this way he will have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.es: Fanny, desesperada ante la situación crítica en la que se encontraba por falta de recursos, decidió emprender su propio negocio; su hermano hizo parte de esta inspiración, él vendiendo pescado la ayudó a iniciar la actividad comercial.  El capital inicial fue aportado por su cónyuge, y fue de $200.000 pesos colombianos, con los cuales se obtuvieron excelentes resultados, tanto que logro comprar un enfriador para diversificar la línea de productos que ella vendía.  Fue así como en el año 2004,  Fanny dio un cambio muy importante en su vida “inicio un negocio prospero”, hoy por hoy es una comerciante que brinda una amplia gama de productos y servicios  que sus mismos clientes piden que les venda, entre ellos se encuentrun el barrio de sur  del municipio de Barranquilla.  Esta mujer es madre de 2 hijos,  un jovencito de 17 años y una niña de 7 años.  Su horario laborar esta comprendido entre las 4 p.m. y 9 p.m., su cadena de comercialización es en visitas que ella les hace a sus clientes cada 15 días y brinda crédito o contado de acuerdo a la preferencia de pago de sus clientes. Sus proveedores son los almacenes y distribuidoras a quienes les realiza las compras de contado, es por ello que realizo un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que hace a esa organización, el cual será invertido en la compra de  papelería, ropa y calzado, con este financiamiento su negocio mejora porque tendrá mas inventario y si está más surtido incrementará sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es tener su propio almacén, y continuar aumentando su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Feeling desperate because of the critical situation that she was faced with due to a lack of financial resources, Fanny decided to start up her own business. Her brother was part of this inspiration; since he was a fish vendor he was able to help her to start up a commercial activity. The initial start up capital of $200.000 Colombian pesos was provided by her husband and with this she obtained excellent results, so much so that she was able to buy a cooler to diversify the range of products that she sold. Due to this, in 2004 she decided to make the most important change of her life and "start a prosperous business". Now she is a businesswoman who offers a wide range of products and services to the customers that place their orders with her in the neighbourhood located in the south of the municipality of Barranquilla. 

Fanny is a mother to two children: a young man of 17 and a little girl of 7. Fanny's working day goes from 4pm to 9pm. She operates her business by visiting her customers every fortnight and offering payment by credit or cash in accordance with her customers' preferences, while her suppliers are the grocery stores and distributors who she buys from in cash. This is the reason why she is applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which will be used to buy stationery, clothes and footwear. With this loan her business will improve because she will have a greater amount of stock and her sales will also increase. Her future goal is to have her own grocery store and to continue increasing her wealth.

loans.use: to buy stationery, clothes and footwear

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana es una mujer de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 10 años, y su negocio es el corte y confección.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un lugar caracterizado por la aglomeración de restaurantes de comida típica, también es dónde se elabora la ‘chicha’ bebida fermentada de maíz.
Roxana es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo trenzado, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos que asisten a la escuela, viven en una casa de ladrillo con electricidad y agua de pozo. Su negocio es el corte y confección de prendas de vestir femeninas, realiza; vestidos de fiesta, trajes de noche y arreglos a prendas como; largo del botapie, cintura de pantalón, etc. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en cuatro años que viene realizando esta actividad. Su sueño es ver culminada la construcción de su casa. Ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería, actualmente el agua que tiene la extrae de un pozo en un balde con una cuerda, es peligroso y no es saludable.
Es por esos motivos que Roxana solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable para su cocina, baño y lavandería para que sus hijos vivan más seguros.
texts.en:
Roxana, age 36, lives with her life partner.  She has an eight year old son and a ten year old daughter.  She is a seamstress.

She is enterprising, independent, a good mother, responsible, and hard-working.  She works in the ‘Sacaba’ area.  The place is known for the conglomeration of typical food restaurants.  It is also where the drink ‘chicha’, which is made from fermented corn, is made.

Roxana has a dark complexion and is medium height.  She has long, braided black hair.  Her mother tongue is Quechua, and she speaks Spanish for business.  She lives with her life partner, who works in construction.  Her children go to school.  They live in a brick house that has electricity and a well for water.

Her business is making women’s clothes.  She makes party dresses, outfits for the evening, and does alterations like adjusting hemlines and the waist on pants, etc.  

This is her first loan cycle with the institution.  She has been engaged in her business activity for four years.

Her dream is to see the construction on her house finished.  She wants to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry.  The water that she uses now she gets from a bucket on a rope from the well.  It is dangerous, and it is not healthy. 

Those are the reasons the Roxana is requesting a loan to install potable water in her kitchen, bath, and laundry so that her children will live safer.

loans.use: to install potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy trabajador y luchador, tiene 01 hijo quien es su mayor motivación en la vida para salir adelante, actualmente trabaja brindando servicios de transporte interurbano con una mototaxi que tiene y cree que le está yendo bien por su constante dedicación y porque siempre se preocupa por la seguridad de sus clientes.
También por iniciativa propia ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de aceite quemado, porque quiere brindar todo lo mejor a su familia.
Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, es decir de cilindros de aceite para así ofrecer mayor cantidad a sus clientes. Con esto sus ventas mejorarán ya que tendrá más pedidos y así más adelante podrá cumplir su sueño de convertirse en un gran empresario y seguirá mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hardworking and determined young man. He has one child, who is his main motivation in life to continue moving forward. He is currently working by providing transportation services with his mototaxi. He thinks it's going well because of his constant dedication and because he always thinking of his customers' safety. 

He has also started his own business selling burnt oil because he wants to provide the best for his family. 

Carlos is very grateful to Kiva lenders for the support that they have provided so that he can purchase a greater quantity of merchandise. He will purchase cylinders of oil so that he can offer a larger quantity to his customers. This way, his sales will increase because he will have more orders. In the future, he will be able to achieve his dream of becoming a great entrepreneur and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cylinders of oil for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more carpentry materials for making sofa sets

loans.name: Andres Edgardo

texts.es: Andrés de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos para comercializarlos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de la casa, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventas en los cuartos pero no tiene de suficiente capital, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de lamina, hierro, balcones, vidrios para ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Andrés is 45 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their son. He makes a living by growing and selling staple grains. He earns enough money to cover household expenses. 

He would like to improve his home by installing doors and windows in the rooms, but he does not have enough capital. He has requested a loan to purchase laminate, iron, balconies, and window glass and to pay laborers so that he and his family can live more comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to purchase laminate, iron, balconies, and window glass, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Elena Marisela

texts.es: Elena tiene 41 años de edad es madre soltera y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de frescos naturales, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal y ya cuanta con clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, ella quiere tener una mejor vida con su familia por esa razón solicita un crédito para comprar variedad de futas, azúcar, hilo, botellas de agua, bolsas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Elena, 41, is a single mother who lives in her own house with her three children.

She earns a living making and selling natural soft drinks.  Her business is located in the town market and she already has steady customers.  With her profits she's able to get ahead.

Elena wants to have a better life with her family, so she's requesting a loan to buy a variety of fruits, sugar, thread, bottles of water, bags, etc., to continue working and to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits, sugar, thread, bottles of water, bags, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven muy alegre y entusiasta, soltero y trabaja como Obrero de campo en su ciudad natal, Ica. En sus tiempos libres le gusta ir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos para poder relajarse luego de un incesante día de trabajo. Él cree que todo le ha ido bien hasta ahora, a pesar de no haber podido estudiar una profesión por algunas situaciones económicas en su hogar, esta es su mayor motivación para luchar y sacar adelante a su familia porque quiere para ellos un futuro mejor.
Carlos está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar materiales como ladrillos, cemento, arena para poder hacer mejoras en su hogar, así estará mejorando la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y continuará saliendo adelante y trabajando con mucho esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very happy and enthusiastic young man. He is single and works as a labourer in his home town, Ica. In his free time he likes to play football with his friends to relax after an intense day of work. He feels that everything has gone well up until now, despite not having studied for a profession due to the financial situation at home. This is his greatest motivation as he strives to bring up his family because he wants a better future for them. 

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because their support will allow him to buy materials such as bricks, cement and sand. With these materials he can make home improvements and improve his quality of life with his loved ones so that he can continue to move forward and work with great effort.

loans.use: to buy materials to make home improvements

loans.name: 032103010001.định Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mr. Thao works in agriculture, raising cattle. He is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

Thao is 49 years old and he is married with two children. Thao is the group leader of the 032103010001.Định Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. He lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thao joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve his  business. Thao has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thao has been involved in his business for more than 10 years.The main hardship that Thao faces in his business is the lack of capital.

With his business profit, Thao hopes to build a new house, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear sales business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Gina has been in this business for four years now.

Gina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maila

texts.en:
Maila is a 40-year-old widow, and she has a daughter. Maila lives with her parents. 

Maila raises and sells seasonal vegetables such as pumpkin, cucumber, potatoes and so on. She has been raising and selling them at the local bazaar for 17 years and has good experience in this area. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. Her elder single brother helps her in this business.

Vegetables are in high demand in Azerbaijan because people like to use them for fresh salads and delicious national dishes. They attend local groceries to buy their fresh and tasty vegetables. They know that vegetables raised in private gardens are always fresh and without pesticides.

Maila needs money to cover her family’s demands. She applied for 1,500 AZN in order to supply quality fertilizers and increase her harvest and income.

loans.use: to supply quality fertilizers and increase harvest and income.

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es: Liliam de 50 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 40 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas y antojitos, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, quesillo, chicharrón, frijoles, harina de arroz, etc. para poder continuar con la elaboración de los alimentos y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Liliam is 50 years old and a single mother who lives in her own home with her two children. For the last 40 years she has worked making and selling pupusas and appetisers. She runs her business from home and she has many customers because of her good prices. 

Liliam is applying for a loan to buy corn, soft cheese, crackling, beans, rice flour, etc. to continue making her meals and obtain a higher income so she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, soft cheese, crackling, beans, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Elbert

texts.en: Elbert a responsible father. He requested a loan from Paglaum MPC, which he will use to increase his inventory of fruits and vegetables. This loan will enable him to sell more products, which will allow him to earn more money and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria used her previous loan to buy bananas and general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell. She is still in the banana and retail shop business where she has added farming to supplement her income. She faces the challenges of limited capital and seasonality. 

Victoria requested a loan, which she will use to buy more stock of maize seeds for planting. She hopes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to purchase more maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Tural

texts.en:
Tural is a 27-year-old single gardener and he lives with his parents. The main source of income for his family is raising and selling seasonal vegetables (cucumber, onion, greens, etc.). This brings him 180 AZN monthly, but he also gets additional earnings working as a labourer in his free time.

Raising vegetables is very popular in Azerbaijan because people have a high demand for fresh vegetables. They use these products to prepare delicious fresh salads and national dishes. 

Tural’s parents are old and they need good care, but this isn’t possible with a small income. So, Tural wants to increase productivity, income, and provide his parents a good life. He applied for 1,000 AZN in order to buy good new fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy good new fertilizers and garden tools

loans.name: Deysi Saraí

texts.es:
Deysi de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a las labores agrícolas, tiene 3 hijos que estudian 6°, 7° y 8° grado, y con su pareja son los encargados del cuido y mantenimiento de sus hijos, vive con su padre y hermana. 

Actualmente es empleada de una empresa de cable, ya tiene de laborar como más de 1 año, anteriormente trabaja como agente de seguridad, viaja a su trabajo todos los días y su horario es de 8 am a 4 pm y le dan el transporte. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar maíz, cal, chicharrón, quesillo y una plancha, para iniciar con el negocio de la pupusería, y lo manejara su hermana más que todo para tener otros ingresos extras al hogar. 

El sueño es que el negocio les funcione y no obtener perdidas y que poco a poco lo vayan agrandando, además seguir trabajando para darles la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Deysi is 30 years old, studied until 9th grade, and is married. Her partner is a farmer and they have three children who are in 6th, 7th, and 8th grade. She and her partner are the ones who care for and support their children. She lives with her father and sister.

She is currently employed at a cable company and has worked there for more than a year. Previously, she worked as a security agent. She travels to her job every day. Her schedule is from 8 am until 4 pm and her employer provides transportation.

She will use the loan that she has requested to purchase corn, lime, pork rinds, soft cheese, and a griddle to start her pupusa business. She will run it with her sister in order to earn extra income for their household.

Her dream is that the business works well, that they do not lose money, and that the business grows little by little. She also would like to continue working to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase corn, lime,  pork rinds, soft cheese, and a griddle to start her pupusa business.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es: Reina de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados y tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, Reina esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
Reina is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She makes a living by selling men's and women's clothing. She sells on foot in various markets and has many regular customers because of the quality of the clothing and the good prices.

Reina requests a loan to purchase more clothing in bulk so that she can continue with her sales and earn more money.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 27 years old, married, and together with his spouse, they have been blessed with two children. Maurice has a motorcycle transport business in Kisumu town and has been in the business for four years. 

Maurice will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to renovate his house.

This is Maurice's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and in the future he hopes to expand his business and live well with his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Nhóm 19 Thôn 5 -Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Na works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Na  is 40 years old and she is married with two children. Na is the group leader of the Nhóm 19 Thôn 5 -Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In 2013, Na joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Na has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Na has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Na faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In future, Na hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be responsible. Serah operates a retail business where she sells drinks, water, biscuits and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area that has potential for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. Serah will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of drinks, biscuits, and other items. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks, biscuits, and other items.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ajuy, Iloilo. Flor is a hardworking woman. Aside from taking care of her children, she also helps her husband in their fishing business. For more than 7 years now, fishing has become their source of income. 

Flor is asking to take a loan from CEVI. She is requesting the loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and bamboo. With this, Flor and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus allowing them to sell more fish to the market. 

In the future, Flor hopes of making their business more sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and bamboo

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman with six children and staying together with her husband. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 20 years, Mwanahamisi has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the 50,000 KES, Mwanahamisi wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Gilbert
