texts.en:
Gilbert is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be patient and outgoing. He operates a food stall where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

Gilbert describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of products. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy a stock of firewood to sell. His business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a decent life for his family. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stock of firewood to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a widow and works hard to support her family. She sells fruits and spices in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 25 years.

Julieta requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more stocks to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Wilson is a civil servant and also practices commercial farming, growing crops such as onions, tomatoes, carrots, rice, and maize to improve the income for his family. Wilson has a dream of having a prosperous family. He is a composed and enterprising person.

Wilson requests money to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and manures, and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizers, and manures, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is married. She has two children. Oksana sells shoes at the market. 

Oksana has used a KIVA loan before. Her previous loan helped her to increase the assortment of shoes and get a bigger income. Oksana was able to take better care of her family. 

This time Oksana is asking for a loan of 31,000 UAH to buy women's shoes. She wants to be able to offer her clients high-quality shoes for the winter season. Oksana hopes to receive additional income and use it to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes for the winter season.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is 40 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a secondary education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities that constitute her family's main source of income. 

She grows vegetables on 2.5 hectares of her own land. She also owns four sheep and one dairy cow, and she sells organic milk and wheat to the local residents. She receives a high demand for her products, and the number of her customers keeps growing every day. For this reason, she has decided to turn to Aqroinvest CU for a loan of 1,500 AZN. She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.  

Zulfiyya plans to re-invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business. She is also planning to save enough money to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.en:
Ederlinda is 58 years old and has ten children; one child is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Ederlinda has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Ederlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Seventy-five percent of the Kenyan population directly depends on small-scale farming for their livelihood in the rural areas. The farming individuals are commonly elderly people between the ages of 45-65 years. However, Caroline has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. At the age of 36 years, she is a proud owner of a farm, where she plants maize and vegetables and keeps dairy cows. 

The farm is in the Kipsaina, Kitale area of Kenya. Caroline practices agriculture with a difference, employing youthful energy, enthusiasm, and knowledge attained from the agricultural training she has undergone with Juhudi Kilimo. Caroline operates the only posho mill in her village. 

Caroline’s sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg-selling; these products are very perishable and require timely delivery to the market, but one problem that she faces is delivering to the market on time. The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads that really hamper timely delivery of products to the market; that is why Caroline is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. 

With the motorbike, she will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits because the products will still be fresh. Caroline is very determined to succeed. Because she is much disciplined with finances, she plans that through accumulated profits, she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and also for her parents. 

Caroline’s dream is to go back to school, and she hopes that through your loan, you will help her realize her dream.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike so she can deliver her products to the market on time.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 52-year-old sari-sari store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She sells items like biscuits, soft drinks, spices, detergent soap, shampoo, coffee, sugar and noodles. Milagros earns about 700 PHP every day. This means a lot to her in helping her husband who is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of 9000 PHP to buy sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, shampoo and condiments. Her two children are adults and living mostly on their own. 

Milagros hopes she and her husband can retire and live in comfort someday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, coffee, shampoo and condiments

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Emilda works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig raising.  Emilda is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Emilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a clean cook stove

loans.name: Optaciano

texts.es: Optaciano de 65 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia desde hace 19 años al lado de su esposa y su nieta de  14 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde muy temprano sale al campo a cultivar la tierra, ya que se gana la vida con el cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace mucho tiempo. Optaciano siempre busca la manera de mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de construir un servicio sanitario de Fosa séptica, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo, hierro, plancha de cemento y letrina para construir un servicio sanitario de fosa séptica.
texts.en: Optaciano, who is 65 years old, has lived in his own house for 19 years,. He lives with his wife and his granddaughter, age 14. He is a hard-working man who goes out to the field very early to cultivate the land, since he has earned his living for a long time by growing corn and beans. Optaciano always looks for ways to improve the living conditions of his family. It is for this reason that he has decided to build a bathroom with a septic tank, but he doesn't have the economic liquidity necessary, and it is for this reason that he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, blocks, iron, a cement slab, and a latrine to construct a septic tank sanitary system.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, blocks, iron, a cement slab, and a latrine to construct a septic tank sanitary system

loans.name: Antonio Nicolas

texts.es: Antonio tiene 48 años de edad y vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañera de vida, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años y con lo que gana de sus ventas logra Salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventanas pero no tienen de suficiente capital por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lamina, hierro, balcones, vidrios para ventana y pago de mano de obra para que el y su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguiros
texts.en: Antonio is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his two children and his life companion. He has been raising corn for a number of years, and with what he earns from his sales he manages to get ahead. He wants to improve his house by putting in doors and windows, but he doesn't have sufficient capital. For this reason he is applying for a loan to purchase the necessary materials such as metal sheeting, iron, balconies, and window glass and pay for labor so that he and his family can live more comfortably and securely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, iron, balconies, and window glass and pay for labor

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 24-year-old merchant from Ajuy, Iloilo. He runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods to the people in his place. John also earns an additional income through his fishing venture.

At present, John wants to take out a loan to buy  more stock for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, detergents, toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. A loan will enable him to improve his store's inventory thus attracting more buyers.

In the future, John has hopes of making his business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy  more stock for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 36-year-old woman, married to Francis who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children.   Mary has been operating a retail shop  for a period of five years, earning herself an income of KES. 8,000 at the end of every month.

Mary is now servicing her second loan of KES. 13,500 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy bar soaps, detergent, milk, bread and fruit to sell to her customers daily.

Mary plans to use the anticipated income to buy a refrigerator and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy bar soaps, detergent, milk, bread and fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of detergent materials to target a lot of commercial stores inside the city.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paint and nails for her fishing business.

Cynthia has been in this business for four years. She earns an additional income from farming and raising chickens.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint and nails

loans.name: Mwanatuma

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house which has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Salama has operated a stall selling vegetables for two years. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 45,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase some incense materials and items to make incense and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mannequin, reception desk, mirror and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy snacks, juice and refrigerated foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicines, examinations, and travel to see a doctor.

loans.name: Alba Noemi

texts.es: Alba de 31 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia pero no poseen luz eléctrica, ella trabaja como emplead de una empresa privada desde hace 8 años, con lo que le pagan en su trabajo y con la ayuda del esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Alba is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house, but they do not have electric light. 

She has been an employee in a private company for the last 8 years. With what she earns in her work and with her husband’s help, they manage to cover a number of expenses for their home. She is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp and charging station, because in the community where she lives no-one has electricity. 

The lamp is also a charging station that gathers energy from solar panels. They are sold in the form of lamps for homes in rural zones where there is no electricity. This purchase will benefit the entire family because it will allow them to have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a Salvasol solar powered lamp and charging station.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct an open sewer to have hygienic practices in his home, ensuring his family's health.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
For the last five years, Melissa of Baybay, Leyte has been in the business of operating a Sari-sari store in her hometown. She sell items like canned goods, toiletries, biscuits, toothpaste in sachet, coffee, milk, and sugar. However, recently she has to make repairs and improvements in her store due to the damaged caused by the recent typhoon.

Melissa is asking for a loan to restock her store with items to sell like noodles, vinegar, spices, canned goods, bath soap, detergent, coffee, and sugar. Melissa puts her hope in the loan so she can support the needs of her four year old son and help her husband.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more profitable for her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles, vinegar, spices, canned goods, bath soap, detergent, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Adonis

texts.es:
Adonis es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia. Desde hace varios años trabaja como mozo en una polleria y con el fruto de su esfuerzo está sacando adelante a su familia, ya que no pudo estudiar una profesión quiere que esto sea distinto para sus hermanas por eso las apoya en todo lo que puede. Es muy alegre, responsable y trabajador.
Adonis quiere ahorrar sus gastos de pasajes, es por ello que está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, ya que con esto va a adquirir una moto para poder transportarse de su hogar a su trabajo y así ahorrar sus pasajes. Con esto podrá seguir apoyando a su familia y más adelante empezar a construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Adonis is a really hard working person with a strong desire to get ahead. He is single and lives in Ica with his family. For the past several years he has worked as a waiter at a rotisserie restaurant. With the fruits of his labor he has been able to provide for his family. Considering that he was not able to study a career, he wants that not to be the case with his sisters and that is why he supports them in every way he can. 
He is a happy, responsible hard worker. Adonis wants to save on his public transportation expenses and this is why he is thankful for the Kiva lenders for their generosity. He will acquire a motorcycle with this loan in order to transport himself from his home to work and in this way save on tickets. This way he will be able to continue supporting his family and later on begin to build his own home.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle to transport himself

loans.name: Santos Eladio

texts.es: Don Santos tiene 55 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee desde hace 8 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Don Santos está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Don Santos is 55 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. For 8 years he has had a little store located in his place of residence. He has many customers because of his good prices and the friendliness that he shows when he makes sales. Don Santos is applying for a loan to be able to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc., and thus be able to have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candies, sweet breads, etc., for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy one motorcycle and with this motorcycle do hairdressing delivery

loans.name: Betty Areli

texts.es: Betty de 44 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado que esta cerca de su casa, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos preciso, Betty esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como cosméticos, esmaltes, ganchos para el cabello, shampoo, tientes para el cabello, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and is a single mother living in her own home with her daughter. She makes a living selling personal use products and her business is located in a market near her home. She has many clients due to the variety of products and the good prices. 
Betty is requesting a loan to purchase more products such as cosmetics, nail polishes, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc. in order to be able to obtain better incomes.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics, nail polishes, hair clips, shampoo, hair dyes, etc.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah is forty-eight years old. She is married and has been blessed with three children, all aged over eighteen. One of her children is working, which provides additional income for the family.

Florah sells groceries and maize, a business she has worked in for the last twelve years, earning a monthly income of 7,000 KES. 

Florah has requested her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya of 50,000 KES which she will use to buy assorted vegetables, carrots in bulk, potatoes, onions, cereals and sacks of dried maize cereal for resale at a profit. She has successfully repaid all her previous loans.

With the anticipated profits, Florah will be able to repay her loan and purchase additional stocks of groceries. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable life and improved standards of living and income.

loans.use: to increase her stock of groceries and maize cereal for sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a twenty-nine-year-old single woman who is taking care of one child and has been operating a boutique shop for six years. She earns herself an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Hannah is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy shirts, blouses, skirts, trousers, and dresses to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Hannah plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: buy shirts, blouses,skirts and trousers to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 64-year-old widow who is blessed with two children. She has been a farmer for eight years, earning herself an income of 8,000 KES at the end of every month.

Esther was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now taking out her first loan of 10,000 KES. She intends to use this amount to buy fertilizers and seedlings.

Esther plans to use the anticipated income to buy additional cows and goats for trading and hopes to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is a single man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells milk, eggs, flour, sugar, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Wambua's business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy more stock of maize flour, sugar, bread, and other items.

He hopes that in the future, he will be a great seller. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of maize flour, sugar, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cement, shutters, lime and paint to complete the house

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is 48 years old and single, with four children. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. Idi is a salt winner (salt miner), harvesting crude salt to sell and using the proceeds to look after his children. Idi has a dream of educating his children and becoming rich. Idi is faced with challenges of weather and seasonal factors. He is requesting a loan to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Silvaina

texts.es: SILVAINA: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad.  Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería, con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de ingresos formo parte del grupo solidario Masagni, que en miskito significa semilla verde, para acceder a financiamiento. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual, para comprar mercadería: chiverías, granos básicos, jabones de baños, de lavar ropa, de lavar traste, detergentes cloros, entre otros productos. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en: Silvaina is a friendly woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has two minor children. Approximately 3 years ago she established her little grocery store, with the goal of improving her quality of income. She formed part of the communal bank group "Masagri," which in Miskito means "Green Seed," in order to have access to financing. She is applying for her first loan in the individual credit mode in order to buy merchandise such as Chiveria dairy products, basic grains, bath soaps, laundry soaps, dish soaps, and chlorinated detergents, among other products. Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dairy products, basic grains, bath soaps, laundry soaps, dish soaps, and chlorinated detergents, among other products.

loans.name: Sophiya

texts.en:
Sophiya is a 54-year-old married mother of four children. She works hard with her husband to provide them with a better living.

Sophiya has worked as a butcher since 2004, and she runs her own grocery store at the same time. Her husband works in an agriculture business; he specializes in pruning plants during just four months of the year, which puts so much more pressure on her to make sure that she can provide her family with what they need the rest of the year.

Today, Sophiya is acquiring her second loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. Her previous loan improved her family's living, and she proved to be a borrower in good standing. Her current loan will be invested in preparing her family for the coming winter season, through buying and storing wood logs needed for warming up on cold days.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her businesses in a well-managed way and attracting more customers.

loans.use: To prepare her family for the coming winter by buying and storing wood logs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as hardworking. 

Joseph operates a dairy farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a competitive area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate finances. 

Joseph will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. His business goal is to be a large-scale producer within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Manuel Angel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica desde hace varios  años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, cuando ya esta su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Manuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 33 years of age and lives in his own home with his life partner. He has been making a living in agriculture for several years, specifically the farming of corn. When his harvest is ready he sells it in the adjacent towns and already has many regular customers. 
Manuel is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc to improve the land shown in the picture in order to continue his crops. With this being his only source of work, he hopes these improvements will help him get better incomes.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides, etc. to improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine and sewing materials to complete a lot of work in a short time.

loans.name: Mercedes Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Santa Ana.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes,  tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y fruto de esta relación tiene 4 hijas de 20, 18, 16 y 14  años de edad, todos estudian en universidad y colegio. Su marido trabaja en el campo.
Doña Mercedes con la finalidad de contar con sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudare a su marido con los  gastos en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo y detergentes, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja de tres a cuatros  días a la semana vendiendo la ropa mientras que los detergentes vende en su casa, vende sus prendas a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 4 años en este negocio el cual le ayuda mucho ya que los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos son muchos. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa y detergentes. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the city of Santa Ana, which is known for its beautiful landscapes and lovely waterfront resorts that are frequented by many tourists, the members of the Communal Bank “Santa Ana” meet every 15 days.

Sra. Mercedes lives in this place. She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four daughters (ages 20, 18, 16, and 14). All of them are studying at either a university or a high school. Her husband is a field laborer.

In order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, Doña Mercedes have been selling all type of clothing, as well as detergents. She conducts her sales by going door-to-door. Mercedes works three to four days each week by selling clothes, while she sells the detergent from her house. She extends credit for the clothing sales and collects payment every eight days. Mercedes has been in business for four years and it has been greatly helpful in allowing her to cover her children’s educational expenses.

This loan will be used to buy clothes and detergents. Mercedes has been with the Communal Bank for eight years and she enjoys being a member because the loans have been used to finance her business. Her dreams include providing the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medications, have an examination, and pay for consults and travel expenses.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en: Ligaya is happy to manage her retailing business. She is selling various grocery items and cooked food for meals. Ligaya has been thorough in this business and wishes to grow the business while she can manage it. She is running out of stock, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more grocery items to sell. Ligaya plans to buy more beverages, powdered coffee, milk, and canned goods. She will also use the loan for cooked food for meals. Ligaya hopes to manage her business well while she is living for a persistent source of income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To assist with remodeling a tailoring area and buy a hanging apparatus for the dresses.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Victoria   está integrado por 18 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rita.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por su familia y por sus seres queridos, se dedica al humilde trabajo de ventas de carbón, y por medio de esto lucha por seguir creciendo. Sueña con mejorar la vida de su familia, que son lo más importante para ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carbón en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y lo cual es el sostén de su familia.
texts.en:
The group called “La Victoria” consists of 18 women who are close-knit and hardworking. They have taken the poverty elimination survey, including one of its members, Sra. Rita.

Rita is a hardworking and determined woman who strives on behalf of her family and loved ones. She works humbly by selling charcoal. Through this business, she is able to keep growing. Rita dreams of improving life for her family since they are very important to her.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal in quantity. This will allow her to continue her sales as before so that she can sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy charcoal in bulk that she can sell.

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la  elaboración de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, atoles, etc. que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza ha logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Maria vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maíz para los tamales, plátanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y así poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 53 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and son. She makes street food such as potato chips, cassava chips, empanadas, tamales, “atole” (a traditional warm beverage made from corn), and other items. Maria conducts her sales as a street vendor near her home. Thanks to her sales, she has been able to cover her household expenses.

Doña Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy products that she uses for making street food such as oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and other ingredients that she uses in her preparation. As a result, she can continue sustaining her household and cover any expenses that may arise.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en: Emerlita’s husband is a farmer. Her husband grows corn in their field. Emerlita’s source of income is buying and selling fruits, and retailing grocery items in their village. Her earnings from her business usually support her three children's needs in school. Emerlita is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy grocery items such as condiments, beverages, and noodles. Emerlita's loan will help her buy grocery items in bulk at wholesale prices. She will be better able to meet her children's needs in school through her earnings from the business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as condiments, beverages, and noodles

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children: one son and two daughters. Two of her children are still in school, and one is married. She has been running a beauty salon for ten years now. She works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asha's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the salon stock with up-to-date products. She opened another salon in Zanzibar and is doing fine with her loan. Asha has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit from her business to pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy new salon products. She dreams of improving her business and building her own house.

Asha will share this loan with her loan group, Sunguchini, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new salon products.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is 51 years old, married and has seven children. Three of her children are attending school. She provides her children's allowances through buying and selling of different vegetables and fruits in their village and by transporting them to Manila. Teofila transports vegetables and fruits once per week. She needs to buy more fruits to fill the truck before transporting. For this, Teofila is asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy more fruits to transport and sell. She hopes to buy more vegetables and fruits, resulting in bigger sales and income for the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to transport and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: study supplies for her classes

loans.name: Erifaza

texts.en: Erifaza, age 65, used the previous loan to buy sugar and salt to sell. The loan helped him to increase his stock and was able to make some profits. However, he had challenges with the coffee and cotton projects whose prices fluctuated, thus reducing his profits. Yet he had invested a lot. He has great hopes of trading at wholesale in the future. Erifaza will use the loan to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil, jelly and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, jelly and soda to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old. She is divorced with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Lydia is a farmer growing crops such as maize, beans, bananas, cassava, and rice for selling to educate her children and meet their basic needs. Lydia has a dream of educating her children and developing her family. Weather changes such as heavy rains and too much sunshine are her major challenges.

Lydia wants money to buy cement and paint to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint to renovate her house.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Dorica is thirty years old and married with four children. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Dorica operates a restaurant in which she gets income to support her family and herself. She has a dream of expanding her business and educating her children. 

Dorica is hardworking; however, she is faced with a challenge of limited capital. She wants money to buy beans, maize flour, g nuts, and rice for cooking and selling.

loans.use: to buy beans, maize flour, g nuts, and rice for cooking and selling.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house, which has electricity and piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married with children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for use in her food selling business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Sovann's Group

texts.en:
Sovann is a 43-year-old rural villager from the Koh Sotin district. She earns a living planting rice as the main source of her family’s income. She has been in this business for 24 years. In her current business she earns about 48,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sovann’s group consists of three members who are all female. She has had two loans with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and completely paid them back, which helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy chickens to raise in order to earn more income for supporting her family. She hopes to make more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Noria

texts.en:
Noria, a 48-year-old married woman, lives with her nine children in Taiz, Yemen. In the kitchen of her house, Noria stores many kinds of drinks, sweets, and water, without a refrigerator. That causes most of the food and drinks to expire quickly and taste bad. Noria wants to purchase a refrigerator for her house to keep the food and drinks cold, but she doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Noria looks forward to improving the condition of her family through purchasing appliances for her house.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and paint to renovate the house from the inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Niyamaddin

texts.en:
Niyamaddin is 37 years old. He is a hardworking man with a great desire to progress in life. His lifetime partner is a housewife and they have five  children. They live in the house he has succeeded in building, thanks to his great dedication, in a rural area .

Thanks to his very hard work, now he has land on which he grows onions and potatoes. Niyamaddin’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise vegetables and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, his productivity has fallen and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase his productivity again and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 56 años de edad y posee una molino nixtamal ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años y adicional a eso también se dedica a la agricultura, posee muchos clientes especialmente las señoras que elaboran tortillas ya que ahí llegan a moler el maíz, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de la casa, Teresa vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, y esta solicitando un crédito para comprar lo necesario para el molino como fajas, discos, cuchillas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 56 years old and has been operating a boiled corn mill in her house for the last two years. In addition she also does some farming. 

She has a lot of clients, especially the women who make tortillas, who come to her to grind their corn. With the earnings from her work she manages to cover some of her living expenses.  

Teresa lives in her own house, with her life partner and their two children. She is requesting this loan to buy consumables for her mill, such as belts, discs, blades, etc., and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy consumables for her corn mill.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia runs a sari-sari store business in their village. To gain more profit, Olivia also engaged herself in buying bananas and importing them from other place. Sometimes she needs to pay the banana owner in advance to assure that she will get their banana products. 

In this connection, Olivia is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more bananas from her regular merchandiser. She believes that the loan will be a big help for her to buy more bananas by giving advance payment to the seller. 

Olivia will be very thankful for the loan you will provide for her because it will be very helpful in growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas from her regular merchandiser.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 48 years. She is married to Oduor and together they have been blessed with 7 children aged between 26 and 13 years. Oduor is a farmer and provides additional income for his family.

Florence is a water distributor as well as a seller of shoes, a business she has done for the last 7 years, earning a monthly income of KES 14,000. 

Florence has requested her sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 70,000 which she will use to add stocks of new and second hand shoes for resale. She successfully repaid all her previous five loans.

With the anticipated profits, Florence will be able to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable source of income and a business which will ensure her children will be educated for life and will enjoy good health.

loans.use: to add stocks of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soil for making bricks and to pay for labor

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 58-year-old woman married to Joseph who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children.  Florence has been operating a retail shop for a period of eight years, earning an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Florence is now servicing her second loan of KES 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this amount to buy soaps, rice, sugar, wheat and maize flour to add to her current stock, which is running out.

Florence plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy soaps, rice, sugar, wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en: Priscila is a youthful 70-year-old shosho (old mum), a small-holder farmer who specializes in horticulture. She is based in a small village called Kapomboi, near Kitale, Kenya. This mother of two has been doing agriculture on her small, fertile piece of land for twenty years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal businesses. Priscila is seeking a loan to expand her horticulture farm. Her biggest challenge over the years as a farmer has been lack of adequate capital. It is very hard for small-holder farmers to save enough capital for expansion since farming is marred with all sorts of external risks, such as climatic conditions, pests and diseases, political instability, fluctuation of prices and high costs of inputs. Because of these factors, the sure way farmers can obtain adequate capital is through leveraging their businesses. With your loan investment, Priscila is going to expand her horticultural farm in order to increase its output. If and when the investment pays off, Priscila will plough the profits back into the farm and increase her asset base.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар 46 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Санобар средне-специальное образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть корова с теленком, также земельный надел мерою 1,00 ГА, на котором Санобар выращивает хлопок и лук. Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Санобар в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Санобар является одним из участником группы "Нурэл", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека. Санобар обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов на ремонт дома, она приобретет краску, цемент, доски. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Санобар планирует и дальше вкладывать в развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Sanobar is 46, married, and the mother of three children. She has a vocational education and has been raising farm animals for many years. She has a cow and a calf, along with 1.0 hectares of land where she plants cotton and onions. Her spouse and children happily help her with her business. They have everything they need to keep cattle. Sanobar is one of two members of the "Nurel" group. She applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy construction materials needed to repair her house, including paint, cement, and timber. She plans to use the profits from her business to continue to expand her activities.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her house

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмира, 46 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее, с 1991 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством. Супруг и дети Эльмиры помогают по хозяйству. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Эльмиры есть 3 дойные коровы, 3 бычка и 15 овец. Ежедневной деятельностью Эльмиры является продажа молока, домашнее экологически чистое молоко пользуется большим спросом. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 97,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а также в будущем построить дом для сына.
texts.en: Elmira is 46, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and has been raising livestock and planting crops since 1991. Her spouse and children help her with the farm work. She currently has three dairy cows, three young bulls, and fifteen sheep. She sells milk every day and organic milk is in high demand. She applied for a loan of 97,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy young bulls to fatten and resell. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to build a house for her son in the future.

loans.use: to purchase young bulls to fatten and resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a mother of four children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, Elizabeth has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Elizabeth dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 Elizabeth wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat and sugar

loans.name: Nyonmo Bei Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nyomo Bei and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Teshie, Accra. They are asking for a loan of GHS 2,800 to expand their businesses. 

Constance is a 25-year-old single mother. She is an uneducated woman but very active and dynamic. She has a strong determination to improve her living conditions, but her capital is still not enough. 

Constance said that she had a small amount of money that she saved up herself. Constance invested that money in her own business. She has managed her business of selling insecticides and Parazone for four years in order to take care of her child and household expenses. Constance thinks this business will be profitable for her, but most of what she earns goes to her family expenses since she is single parent. 

To expand further, Constance is requesting a loan of GHS 600 from ID Ghana in order to purchase more insecticides and Parazone to sell to the customers in her area.

Constance expects a boost in her income. She looks forward to expanding her business through selling more insecticides and Parazone.

loans.use: To purchase more insecticides and Parazone to sell to the customers in her area.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es: Roger: Es un hombre luchador, casado con 4 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 1 año  estableció una carnicería. Los productos los provee a través de su finca, donde engorda el ganado y a los cerdos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: cerdos pequeños (lechones) para el engorde y su comercialización. Su sueño es establecer una distribuidora para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Roger is a strong, married man with 4 grown children. In order to have his own source of income, he became a butcher 1 year ago. His products come from his farm, where he fattens cattle and pigs. He is asking for a loan to buy: small pigs (piglets) to fatten up and sell them. His dream is to establish a distributor to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten up and sell them.

loans.name: Zumrud

texts.en:
Zumrud is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house. Her family’s income is mainly from farming and husbandry. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years and her husband is helping her in this business. She needs to raise vegetables and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for her. Because of this problem, her productivity has fallen, and she can’t cover the family’s needs. 

Zumrud applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to her garden weekly. This will increase her productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to her garden weekly

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Angélica tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge hace 4 años en su casa de dos pisos de material rustico, ubicada en el caserío Sillangate en el distrito de Querecotillo que pertenece a la provincia de Cutervo en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. El pueblo es una pequeña zona rural y la señora presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos.

Angélica se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante, desde hace 4 años, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio pero también realiza labores agrícolas y actualmente siembra 1 haz. de cultivo de café.

El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en abarrotes y parte en bebidas como cerveza y gaseosa ya que también vende este tipo de productos, lo cual le permitirá generar más ventas. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Angélica is 49 years old and has been living with her husband in a two-story house made of basic materials for the past four years. Their home is located in the village of Sillangate in the District of Querecotillo in Cutevo Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The town is in a small rural area. Sra. Angélica has good personal and work-related references from her neighbors.

Angélica has been selling food in her restaurant for the past four years. Her husband helps with the business, but he also does farm work. He is currently planting one hectare of coffee.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in groceries and partially in the purchase of beer and sodas since she also sells these types of products. As a result, she will be able to generate more sales. In the short term, Angélica will be able to increase her earnings, improve her income, and eventually improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her restaurant, as well as beer and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema  is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby and her business is at the peak  when people have harvested. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Rehema  dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans, and rice for sale  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize, beans, and rice to sell

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.ru: Бурулбубу 52 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Бурулбубу среднее образование, с 2009 года она занимается животноводством, выращиванием, заготовкой и реализацией сельхозкультур – овощей и фруктов. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 30 овец и 1 лошадь. На участке мерою 1,40 Га, она выращивает горох, фасоль. Вся семья с радостью помогает Бурулбубу в ведении ее бизнеса. Так как вся продукция Бурулбубу экологичная, домашняя и чрезвычайно вкусная, она пользуется большим спросом и число покупателей растет с каждым днем. Бурулбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы и 15 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Burulbubu is 52 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. Burulbubu has a secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry, growing, preparing and selling agricultural products - vegetables and fruits - since 2009. Her business contains 1 cow, 30 sheep and 1 horse. She grows peas and beans on 1.40 hectares of land. The whole family happily helps Burulbubu with running her business. Because all of Burulbubu's products are ecologically clean, home-made and extremely tasty, they are in high demand, and the number of customers grows each day. Burulbubu requested a loan in the amount of 125,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy one cow and 15 sheep. She is planning to invest the earnings from the loan in further increasing her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy one cow and 15 sheep in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es: Argentina: Es una mujer amable, trabajadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 1 hijo, en edad escolar. Desde hace 8 años habita en una vivienda de tambo, de madera, en casa de su suegra.  Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: pintura, playcem, madera, clavos y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Argentina is a hard-working and nice woman who is from Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has one school-aged child. She has lived in her mother-in-law's wood home on stilts for the past eight years. 

She is requesting funding to buy building materials: paint, Plycem, wood, nails and to cover the labor costs. Her dream is to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy building materials: paint, Plycem, wood, nails and to cover the labor costs.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña  pulpería y venta de ropa usada. Con los créditos brindados anteriormente por PANA PANA y a las ganancias percibidas, le han permitido mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, chiverías, una paca de ropa mixta, entre otros. Su sueño es tener un negocio próspero y ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juliana is a kind woman from Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has two children of legal age. 

With the goal of having her own source of income, she set up her small grocery store and started selling used clothing two years ago. The loans that PANA PANA has granted her in the past and her profits have enabled her to improve the infrastructure of her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: basic grains, snacks, and a bale of mixed clothing, among other products.

Her dream is to have a thriving business and expand her home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: basic grains, snacks, and a bundle of mixed clothing, among other products.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
HELLO LENDERS! Meet Ann, a very hardworking, energetic mother of three lovely children. Ann resides in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming activities. Ann has been doing mixed farming for the past 22 years and through those years, she has gathered so much experience with the techniques of farming. Through the income from farming, she has been able to take care of her family and provide the basic needs for her children. Ann is a very enterprising woman, and although she never got formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her family of a decent meal. 

The Kitale area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Ann feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Ann is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. All that Ann waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Martin Alonso

texts.es:
Martin es un hombre que siempre ha sido amante de los estudios. A sus 58 años de edad ha obtenido el título de abogado, de finanzas y está  punto de conseguir el de contabilidad, pues está cursando el cuarto año de la carrera de Contabilidad pública y auditoria, luego que tuviera la oportunidad de trabajar con el sistema contable de una empresa.
Desde hace 10 años Martin trabaja como abogado y notorio, sirviendo de sustento para su esposa y para sus cuatro hijos de las edades entre 24 a 13 años. Actualmente también tiene un contrato con otra empresa brindando servicios contables y legales. Él está solicitando un préstamo para pagar su título como contador, esto le permitirá convertirse en un contador público autorizado. Entre sus metas está crear una sociedad de auditores.
texts.en:
Martin is a man who has always loved to study. At 58 years old he obtained a law degree, finance and is about to get his accounting degree. As it is his fourth year in Public Accounting and Auditing, he has the opportunity to work with the accounting system in a company.

For 10 years, Martin worked as a lawyer and notary, supporting his wife and their four children aged between 13 and 24 years. Currently, he also has a contract with another company to provide accounting and legal services. He is asking for a loan to pay for his degree as an accountant, which allows him to become a certified public accountant. Among his goals, he wants to create an auditing company.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Noong Het 8 Group

texts.en:
Huong is young Thai ethnic woman who works at agricultural activities for a living. She is married and has two children who are boys aged 6 and 8. They live with her mother-in-law in a traditional Thai house. 

To provide for her family, Huong and her husband have to work hard at farming. Just like many other households in the village, cultivating rice is also the main production of Huong's family, with which they have plenty of experience. However, rice production doesn't bring enough income to cover living expenses for her family and pay tuition fees for their children. For that reason, she has diversified into more agricultural activities, including raising pigs, chickens, and buffalo. Among those businesses, raising pigs generates more earnings than the others, so she has decided to expand her pig raising. 

To do that, she has taken out loans from Anh Chi Em Program for more capital for investment and to receive training and technical support from the Program. This is the third loan she has had and she will use the loan to buy piglets. Huong hopes her investment will go well so she may gradually improve her family's living conditions, especially for her children to have a good education. In the picture, Huong stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Kisarawe One Group

texts.en:
Mather, who is in her mid 50s is married with seven kids and only one is still at school. The rest of the kids are grown-up. She has been running a retail shop for five years now.  She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Mather's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her retail shop inventory and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay for her child's college fees, build her house and covered her household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her retail shop inventory. She dreams of building a nice and comfortable house.  

Mather will share this loan with her loan group "Kisarawe One" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her retail shop inventory.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is 26 years old. He lives with his parents in Gaza. He has a clothes shop. He has been involved in the retail business for three years.

His house was fully destroyed, and he would like to repair it again, so he trying now to take the first step until he can get back to his normal life with his family. For these reasons, he has requested a loan from Ryada to build ceiling and walls to start, install pipelines, doors and windows, and buy building materials for renovating his home. Tareq is very grateful to everyone who helps him. He hopes to be able to be back to his normal life with his family again, and to provide good living conditions for his children.

loans.use: to build ceiling and walls to start, install pipelines, doors and windows, and buy building materials for renovating his home.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can take financial assistance for her chosen business. She has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. 

She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner. Recently, she took a loan to purchase bags of feed and hog vitamins for her hog raising business. Marissa wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and hog vitamins.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 61 years old and married. Together with his spouse, he has been blessed with 5 children. He does poultry farming in Kisumu town and has been in this business for 6 years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000 and it has been a profitable business. 

He plans to use this loan to buy more chicks for rearing. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and also repay the loan.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to improve his business, make more income and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, a married woman, lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Joan operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in the area. Joan decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and is now requesting a Kshs 50,000 loan to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice for use in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Josie Alejandra

texts.es:
El espíritu emprendedor de Josie siempre ha estado presente en su vida. Hace dos años, luego de haber iniciado la universidad para convertirse en licenciada en administración de empresas, empezó junto a su esposo su negocio de venta de pate. Ahora ella tiene 21 años y ya está en el tercer año de la universidad. Siente que todo va por un excelente camino, pues en la universidad aprende a cómo formar un negocio estable y a cómo hacerse cargo del manejo de ese.
Josie cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y de su madre, pues junto a ellos han podido salir adelante. En estos momentos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una computadora, ya que es una herramienta fundamental para su carrera y para la realización de sus trabajos. Entre sus planes está terminar con honores su carrera y poner en práctica lo aprendido para llevar al éxito su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Josie's entrepreneurial spirit has always been present in her life. Two years ago, after having started college to become a graduate in business administration, she and her husband started a business selling spread. Now she is 21 and is already in her third year of university. 
She feels that everything is going well, as she is learning at university how to form a stable business and how to take charge and manage it.
Josie has the unconditional support of her husband and mother, it is because of them that she has been able to succeed. Right now she is requesting a loan to buy a computer, as it is an essential tool for her career and for performing her jobs. Among her plans is to finish her course with honors and implement what she learns to make her own business a success.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Paula Andrea

texts.es:
Paula es una bella mujer de 33 años de edad, madre de dos hijos de 13 y 9 años, perseverante y emprendedora.

Inicio su etapa productiva en distintos salones de belleza, hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido pues también quiere vender productos para complementar sus servicios, como crema de manos, gel, productos capilares, tinturas para cabello, barnice y cambiar su equipo mejorando su plancha para cabello, secador e instrumentos como máquina para motilar, cepillos, peines, entre otros.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese y tenga muchos clientes ya que será determinante porque dejo su hogar para aventurarse en la ciudad buscando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Paula is a pretty, 33-year-old woman, mother of two children who are 13 and 9. She is persevering and proactive. 

She began her working life as an employee in various beauty salons, until one day she decided to take a risk and look for her own clientele, setting up a salon in her house. 

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies as she would also like to sell products to complement her services, like hand cream, gel, hair products, hair dyes, and nail polish, as well as buying better equipment including a better hair straightener, dryer, clippers, brushes and combs, for example. 

This loan is very important because it will allow her to consolidate her business, filling it out with all the supplies and equipment she needs to work and offer whatever service her clients may ask of her. 

Her dream is to see her business grow and have a lot of clients, which will be decisive because she left her home to try her luck in the city, searching for a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies as she would also like to sell beauty products to complement her salon services.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en:
Nurana is 30 years old, married and has 2 kids. Nurana is a teacher and her husband is a driver. 

In her free time, she raises vegetables on her own land. Nurana has been growing seasonal vegetables and greens for 4 years and has good experience in this area. She grows onions, cucumbers and greens. Her husband sells them at the local bazaar. Her monthly income is 180 AZN.

Vegetables are in high demand during the year and people buy them every day. They use vegetables to cook soups, dishes with fried vegetables and other tasty things. 

Nurana ’s income from gardening doesn't cover the family’s needs. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy other, different, kinds of vegetables and fruits to grow.

loans.use: to buy other kinds of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 53-year-old married father of two children, a Palestinian refugee who works hard to provide his family with the necessities of life. The sole breadwinner of his family, he puts much effort into providing them with everything they ask for, but his income is very low, and improving his business is difficult due to increasing family expenses.

Nabil is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to improve and develop his business through the purchase of a new heater, oven, trays and kettles that will develop and increase his business quality and production.

This is Nabil's first experience as a Al Majmoua borrower; he hopes that after this loan  he will start planning for future developments and business expansions that will help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new heater, oven, trays and kettles.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, Carolyne has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

Carolyne is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who has six kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Kiti

texts.en:
Kiti is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She operates a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to expand his house.

loans.name: Ledella

texts.en:
Anticipating the next cropping season, Ledella wants to have a good supply of corn fertilizer with which to prepare her land. She has therefore requested a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

Ledella hopes to save enough to buy more agricultural land for the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy corn fertilizer to prepare her land for seeding.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposa, el tiene un puesto de venta de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Manuel esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente y asi poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Manuel, 36, lives in his own house with his son and his wife.  He has had a food stall near his home for two years.  He's able to pay the household expenses with the profits he earns from his sales.

Manuel's requesting a loan to buy more rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other ingredients to vary his menu and have a bit more income.  That way he'll have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more rice, chicken, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Zoe has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish-selling business for over ten years, selling from her home to restaurant operators and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una buena calidad de vida. 

Desde hace más de 2 años comenzó a trabajar vendiendo productos en la calle de manera ambulante, y gracias a un gran esfuerzo que hizo logró ubicarse dentro de un local y allí tiene su negocio hasta ahora donde ofrece productos para el hogar y de belleza a sus clientes.
