Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Beatriz busca un préstamo para comprar productos para el hogar, perfumería y tinturas para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su miscelánea.

De esta manera su negocio saldrá adelante y podrá ofrecer en su hogar unos buenos ingresos para que sigan teniendo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz is married and has 2 children. Thanks to the income she makes from her business she can contribute economically to the household, alongside what her husband contributes, so that they can improve the economic conditions of their family and enjoy a good quality of life. 

She started selling products as a street vendor more than 2 years' ago. Thanks to all the effort she put in she managed to get herself a premises which is where she still runs her business from today, offering household and beauty products to her customers. 

Because her customer-base is growing along with their increasing demand for more products, Beatriz is requesting a loan to buy household products, perfumes and dyes so she can offer her customers a better variety of miscellaneous products. 

By doing this her business will grow and she will be able to make a better income so her family can continue enjoying a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy household products, perfumes and dyes to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.es:
El señor Antonio es un agricultor muy habilidoso con experiencia en varias áreas de la agricultura, con un talento innato para el trabajo en equipo y una gran mente emprendedora.

Tiene un cultivo de yuca que atiende todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijas por las cuales ha tratado de luchar siempre para sacarlas adelante.

El desea darle un impulso a su cultivo y obtener mejores ingresos de este por eso pide un auxilio económico para invertirlo en insumos agropecuarios como pesticidas, abonos y semillas de yuca, el préstamo le dará la oportunidad de tener un producto de mejor calidad.

Su mayor sueño es tener una casa propia y brindarles a sus hijas un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Antonio is a very skilled farmer with experience in various areas of agriculture, an innate talent for teamwork, and a great entrepreneurial mind. He has a yucca crop that he tends every day from the early hours of the morning. Currently, he lives with his wife and his four daughters, for whom he has always tried to fight in order to move them forward.

He wants to give his crops a push and earn a better income. This is why he is asking for financial support to invest in agricultural supplies like pesticides, fertilizer, and yucca seeds.  The loan will give him the opportunity to have a product of better quality. His greatest dream is to have his own house and to provide his daughters with a good future.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies like pesticides, fertilizers, and yucca seeds for his crops

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer, 41 years old, is from Kiminini, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Although she earns a handsome profit from farming, she faces one big challenge: the high prices being charged for fertilizers, seedlings and inputs. The Kiminini area has only one agro dealer catering to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a killing from farmers by charging them higher prices and so enjoying a monopoly.

Jenifer wants to change this. She is requesting a 65,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to start an agro-vet shop. Through this loan she will be able to help the smallholder farmers in her area, who for a long time have had a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs. She will also transition from the smallholder farmer she is right now to being a certified agro dealer who will be depended on by nearly 1,000 smallholder farmers in her area both for input, knowledge and information about improved inputs.

Through increased income from the loan, Jenifer will improve her living conditions as well. Her future plans are to purchase a truck to be used to engage farmers in output marketing activities. She believes one can find rewarding employment in farming. She patiently waits for your kindness.

Jenifer is only one of a new generation of farmers who are realizing that the elusive white-collar job is not worth chasing after all. This crop of young energetic farmers has its eyes on good money, the kind that salaries will not give them. They have turned to agriculture.

The idea of earning a decent yet fixed income is now old-fashioned. Now, integrating traditional agriculture with new technology is how young farmers are boosting high-quality yields and profits. They are using knowledge gained from various agricultural training programs to create innovative products and add value to existing ones.

loans.use: To start an agrovet shop and so break the monopoly on the cost of farm inputs in her area

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. 

Kevin decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for his shop inventory.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for his shop inventory

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 45-year-old married woman. She is running a business of milk-selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Fareeda’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However, they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Fareeda has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and thus provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Hassel Yadipcia

texts.es:
El altruismo y la generosidad al ayudar a las otras personas, son dos de muchas de las cualidades que tiene Hassel de 24 años de edad, una madre soltera de dos hijos y estudiante del cuarto año de la licenciatura en enfermería. A ella siempre le ha gustado ayudar a los demás y apoyar con su conocimiento a todas las personas que la necesitan, razón suficiente para poder cumplir con su sueño de convertirse en una enfermera. 
Afortunadamente Hassel cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres, quienes trabajan en un hospital, y con su propio esfuerzo con su trabajo como operadora. En estos momentos solicita un préstamo para pagar la mensualidad de sus estudios y el trámite de su diploma, asegurando el título que la oficiará como licenciada gracias a ese crédito. En sus planes está seguir creciendo profesionalmente, nunca abandonar sus sueños y estudiar una especialidad.
texts.en:
Altruism and generosity in helping others are two of the many qualities that Hassel, 24, boasts. She is a single mother of two and a student in her fourth year of Bachelor of Nursing. She has always enjoyed helping others and gives knowledge and support to all who need it. This is the reason she wants to fulfill her dream of becoming a nurse.
Fortunately, Hassel has the support of her parents, who work in a hospital, and through her own efforts works as an operator. Right now, she is requesting a loan to pay her study and degree processing fees, securing the title that will allow her to work in this field. She plans to continue to grow professionally, never give up on her dreams and to study a specialty.

loans.use: to pay her study and degree processing fees.

loans.name: Altaf

texts.en:
Altaf is a 37-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three children. Her husband has been running his own tailoring shop in the local market for many years. He alone is responsible for meeting the financial needs of the entire family.

Altaf's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories (e.g., pieces of cloth, needles, and sewing machine accessories). But due to some financial constraints, he is not able to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Altaf has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will financially assist her husband to buy these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that he can earn a more profitable income.

For this financial assistance Altaf is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of tailoring accessories for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmen Manuela

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 68 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus  7 hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son  mayores de edad, cinco  de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Carmen es una mujer muy luchadora que a pesar de su edad le gusta ganar lo suyo para no depender de nadie, ella se dedica a vender productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería, cosméticos y accesorios) trabaja todos los días, más que todo por las mañanas ya que a esa hora se le hace más fácil salir a visitar a sus clientes,  entrega todos sus productos a crédito y  cobra cada quince días,  lleva 2 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual sale adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar cremas, perfumes, bisutería y cosméticos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que les brinda la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Juan Eudes credit group meets every 2 weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, well-known at the national and international levels. This is where the famous Toquilla straw hats are made. 

This is where Carmen lives. She is 68 years old, and lost her husband several years ago, leaving her alone with her 7 children. The children are all adults now, and five of them still live in her house. Carmen is a very determined woman, who despite her age wants to earn her own money so she doesn’t have to depend on anyone. 

She earns her living selling Yanbal products (beauty products, perfume, cosmetics, jewelry and accessories). She works every day, mostly in the mornings as it is easier for her to go out and visit her clients at this time. She delivers her products on credit and collects payments every two weeks. She has been doing this job for 2 years, and it allows her to get by. This loan will be used to buy lotions, perfume, jewelry and cosmetics. 

She has been part of the credit group since it began, and likes it for the benefits and help offered by the institution. Her dream is to continue making her living.

loans.use: to buy lotions, perfume, jewelry and cosmetics.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
For most people hitting the 50-year-mark means a life of absolute reliance on their children or immediate family members for their livelihood. However, for Beatrice, somehow life begins at 50. 

This mother of seven has been practising mixed farming for the past twenty four years on her small parcel of land in the Kitale area of Kenya and has been earning a decent income. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate into an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry sales to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and is staying together with her husband and their children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

Sidi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Alexandra María

texts.es:
Alexandra, de 36 años, ha optado por montar un negocio de comidas rápidas en un carrito de comidas en el municipio de Medellín. 

Alexandra trabaja cuatro días a la semana por 5 horas, esto es porque debe estar pendiente de sus 3 hijos y cumplir sus labores de madre, es una mujer muy responsable, juiciosa y aplicada con su negocio.

Entre sus sueños más latentes esta el poder tener un restaurante en el que ofrezcan distintos tipos de alimentos y puede ofrecer empleos.

Ella pide un aliento económico para capitalizar su negocio y comprar insumos como pollo, aceite, harina, entre otros, además de poder conseguir un carro de comidas mejor.

El crédito impactara su vida y su negocio de un modo muy favorable pues podrá cumplir con su sueño y tendrá una mayor variedad de alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes, además de que de este negocio dependen sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Alexandra, 36, has chosen to build a fast food business with a food cart in the city of Medellin.

Alexandra works four days a week for 5 hours, this is because, you must be aware, of her 3 children and she fulfills her duties as a mother. She is a very responsible and sensible woman who is applied to her business.

Among her dreams is being able to have a restaurant that offers different types of food and can provide jobs.

She is asking for a loan to capitalize her business and to buy supplies like chicken, oil, flour, etc., and so she can get a better meal cart.

This loan will impact her life and business in a very positive way because she can fulfill her dream and have a greater variety of foods to offer her customers, plus her three children depend on this business.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as chicken, oil, flour, among others.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a single woman from Kenya. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to excel in business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Quiteria Natividad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Juan Eudes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Quiteria, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 14 años de edad, el cual estudia en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Quiteria para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, ella  tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de víveres, colas y muchos alimentos que los padres compran para mandar a la escuela a sus pequeños, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio cuando puede, lleva más de 12 años con su negocio y le va bastante bien y gracias a los créditos cada vez lo surte mas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito  desde hace 12 años  y le gusta porque con un crédito empezó su negocio. Sus metas son seguir aumentado su negocio y darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The Saint John Eudes Loan Bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its craftwork which is nationally and internationally recognized. It is also the home of the famous straw sombreros. 

Quiteria lives here, who is 32 years old, married, and from this relationship has a 14-year-old son who studies at a college in the area. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to earn money on her own, Quiteria makes a living in the commercial sector. She has a small convenience store where she sells all kinds of provisions, soft drinks, and many foods that parents buy to send to school with their children. She works every day from 6:00 AM to 8:00 PM, sometimes later. Her son helps her with her business when he can.

She has had her business for over twelve years, and it is going quite well thanks to the loans that supply it more each time. She is going to use this loan to buy food and provisions to further supply her store. She has been in the Saint John Eudes Loan Bank for twelve years and likes it because she started her business with a loan. Her goals are to continue growing her business and to give the best to her child.

loans.use: To buy food and provisions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy earth to make bricks and pay for labor

loans.name: Eduardo Manuel

texts.es:
Eduardo es casado y padre de 1 hijo. Toda su vida fue criado en el campo, donde ha realizado actividades agropecuarias la mayor parte de su vida.  

Actualmente posee cultivos de Yuca y plátano y complementa con la producción de leche, de varias vacas que son de su propiedad, tanto la cosecha de plátano, como los litros de leche que ordeña a diarios, son vendidos en el mercado de la región donde reside, así logra obtener los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Eduardo es un hombre serio, responsable, comprometido con su familia y su trabajo, por ello siempre quiere seguir avanzando es busca de un futuro mejor, por esta razón solicita su crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas) con el fin de continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y poder sacar una cosecha en óptimas condiciones para poderla vender a un mejor precio en el mercado y obtener más ganancias; todo esto le ayudará a seguir adelante, mejorando poco a poco su nivel de vida y el de su familia, a los cuales les podrá ofrecer mejor educación para que tengan un futuro próspero y lleno de éxitos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is married and is the father of 1 child. He was born and bred in the countryside where he has undertaken farming activities for most of his life. 

Now he has yuca and banana crops and complements this with milk production from various cows, which are his own property along with the banana yield and the litres of milk he milks everyday. He sells his produce in the regional market, allowing him to make enough of an income to meet his household's daily needs.

Eduardo is serious man who is responsible and committed to his family and work. Because of this he always wants to keep moving forward in search of a better future. He is requesting a loan to invest in buying farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) so he can continue to look after his crops and be able to produce a harvest in the best possible conditions, allowing him to sell his produce for a higher price in the market and make more of a profit. All of this will help him to keep moving forward, little by little improving his quality of life and that of his family, who he will be able to offer and better education to so they have a prosperous future which is full of success.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides) so he can continue to look after his crops.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of 3 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began her business of milk selling.

Perveen owns buffaloes for milking. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and thereby to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar  is a 42 year old, single woman. She is a hard-working lady who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers, buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Kachere Group

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman who supports her family by selling assorted groceries and wrappers. She is 36 years old and has three children and also takes care of one orphan. All of the kids go to school. 

She is applying to a loan to increase her inventory and sell new products in her store such as soap, cooking oil, and sugar, and thus satisfy her customers' needs.

Amina wants to expand her business and to resolve any household problems with her profits generated. As a woman she is has managed to buy land for constructing a good house for her family and she is able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store's inventory

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has  provided transportation services driving a taxi for many years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to maintain his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires daily maintenance. Due to insufficient funds, he is unable to maintain the taxi. Shazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

The loan will help Shazia's husband to easily afford the maintenance cost. He will be able to provide better transportation services and earn a profitable income. Shazia also plans to save the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shazia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay for the repair of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, a 40-year-old married father of two, is a Palestinian refugee who has  worked as a pastry baker since 1995. He started his own business in 2004, while he has operated his current bakery since 2012.

Ahmad is developing his business gradually by moving from one location to a better one in order to increase his income and customers.

He requests his seventh loan  from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to purchase flour, oil, thyme, and cheese which will increase his production and income in a well managed way.

His previous loan proved to be very impressive and developed his business properly, that's why he is very optimistic about this loan.  He is a borrower in good standing. 

He hopes that in the future, he can buy his own bakery to save rental fees and to diversifying his products to meet customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase flour, oil, thyme, and cheese.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 66 years old, married and has been blessed with 6 children. He farms in the town of Thika to grow crops and raise livestock. He has been in the farmed for10 years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy goats. 

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and his future hopes are to improve his farming ,earn more income, and  improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy goats..

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Salama has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market where there are passers by and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to buy hair braids, hair nutrients, chemicals and shampoo for her salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, hair nutrients, chemicals and shampoo for her salon business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de campo y madre viuda de 4 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos de engorde.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos materiales para la construcción de su galpón y la compra de gallinas de engorde y pollos para iniciar con este negocio.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Teresa is a rural woman and the widowed mother of 4 children. She has been through many hardships in her life but has always had the strength to move forward and continue to progress with her family. She has wanted to start a business raising and selling broiler chickens for a long time.

She is requesting this great economic encouragement to buy some materials for building a shed and to buy hens and broiler chickens to start her business.

With this new business, she can generate income for her family that can improve the quality of life for her children. She will work every day to boost her business and make it a sustainable and profitable business.

Support a hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a shelter for them

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is a 25-year-old married woman. She is been running a beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. That is why she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers. She will put the profits she gains toward building her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a house for his children.

loans.name: Shaissta

texts.en:
Shaissta  is a 46 year old, married woman. She has 4 children. 

Shaissta  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her  to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet customer's orders on time and earn a good amount of profits. 

This monetary help can take Shaissta  closer to her dream of providing a quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet customer's orders on time and earn good profits.

loans.name: Rukhsar

texts.en:
Rukhsar is 22 years old and a married woman. She does tailoring service for many years to support her husband. Her husband works alone for the family and his income cannot meet all the household expenses and the educational needs for the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. 

Together with her husband, Rukhsar manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces so that she can meet the tailoring orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Rukhsar hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies such as threads, buttons, ribbons, and laces

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia  is a 31-year-old, married woman. She has successfully run a small, home-based general store with her husband. Her husband  assists her by purchasing goods from the market and has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of 4  and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care. She wants to grow her business so she requests 40,000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to attract more customers and increase her earnings to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juices to attract more customers and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a freshman who wants to pursue a Bachelor’s degree in the Journalism and Mass Communications Program, here’s his story:

“My name is Sulaiman, I’m a freshman at the American University in Central Asia. Right now I’m at a very exciting period of my life, I’m meeting new people and getting to know how to live in a different town. I am from Osh, a town that is 300 miles away. My parents and relatives live and work there. Now I have to become independent and study hard. 

I graduated from my high school as one of the top three students with the highest grades. I already knew then that I would like to be a journalist. I enjoyed all that I did while I was writing for our school newspaper called “Sema Times”. I helped to edit stories, take pictures and distribute it to my classmates. 

One thing I would like to note is that I am the youngest of four children in the family and none of my siblings have university degrees. This makes my decision to enrol in university more challenging. I think my family is expecting a lot of accomplishments that I will pursue. 

I hope my education at AUCA will help me become a productive and well-rounded professional in the future”.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a maize farmer from Nigeria. 

A loan from Kiva helps Halima to purchase fertilizer for her crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable her to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  Halima had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as clothing, food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows her to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income. Halima expressed a desire use her additional income to educate her children, and hopes hope to make more money for herself and her family in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and stock her harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en:
Bulus is a maize farmer from Nigeria. 

A loan from Kiva helps Bulus to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  Bulus had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as clothing food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

When asked, Bulus mentioned his intent to use his additional income to educate his children, with a view to them gaining access to professional jobs.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and stock his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila is a freshman student at the American University in Central Asia. Here’s her story: 

“My name is Kamila. I’m from a rural town Batken. Now I am a freshman with highest expectations from my studies. I think my story is worth hearing about, because it was hard for me to get where I am now. After I graduated from my high school, I wanted to study here. However, my parents wanted me to study medicine and become a doctor. I went to medical academy, and after two years, I had to fight against my parents’ decision and persuade them to let me study in liberal arts university. I did not enjoy studying in medical academy at all. My parents were upset about the whole thing, however they agreed with my decision. 

"Now, I know that one has to fight to achieve any goals. It was a good lesson for my life, now I know that I have to fight hard for my decisions 'til the end. I chose Anthropology Department, and I would like to learn about cultures, people and many other exciting things. Financial aid from AUCA and Kiva would help me to achieve my goals for life. The Anthropology Department of AUCA is the best one in Kyrgyzstan. It gives a chance to practice your knowledge in different parts of Kyrgyzstan and abroad. I am looking forward to them."

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children aged between 12 years old and 10 months old.

Beatrice sells clothes, a business she has done for the last 5 years. She earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES. Beatrice has requested a first loan with VisionFund Kenya for 20,000 KES which she will use to purchase more stock of used clothes. With the anticipated profits, Beatrice will be able to repay her loan as well as improve her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become a renowned businesswoman in her town and to have a stable source of income and business which will ensure her children's education for a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
Jose desde muy temprana edad aprendió el oficio de confección de calzado gracias a su mamá que toda su vida fue confeccionista y fue así como poco a poco Jose empezó a entender y aplicar estos conocimientos.

Tiene dos hijos de 7 y 5 años por los cuales ha tenido que responder durante algún tiempo.

Es un padre emprendedor, amoroso y siempre dispuesto a atender a sus clientes de la mejor manera.

Se siente muy agradecido con todo lo que ha podido construir hasta ahora.
El pide un apoyo económico para comprar insumos como cuero y suelas para así poder aumentar su volumen de producción al mismo tiempo que ofrece un empleo.

Tiene muchas esperanzas en su negocio y conserva la ilusión de tener un taller mucho más grande.
texts.en:
Jose learned the art of shoemaking from a very young age thanks to his mother, who was a shoemaker all her life. In this way he began understanding and applying this knowledge little by little.

He has two children, 7 and 5 years old, for whom he has had to take responsibility for some time. He is a self-motivated and loving father, always available to serve his customers the best he can. 

He feels very grateful for all that he has been able to piece together up until now.

He is requesting financial support to purchase supplies such as leather and soles in order to increase his production volume while also offering employment.

He has high hopes for his business and maintains his dream of having a much larger shop.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as leather and soles in order to increase his production volume.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman who has three children. When asked, she describes herself as humble. For the past five years she has operated a business selling clothes. Her shop is located in an area with many customers.

Elizabeth received a previous loan through SMEP and repaid it successfully. She is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock. Her business goal is to see her business well-grown within five years and to open in more locations. Her personal goal is to educate her children.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia  is a 35-year-old, married woman. She has been involved in the business of selling fabric. She purchases a variety of material at low prices from the city market and sells them in her  town. She has a strong customer base. 

Safia requests 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors.  This will help to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 55-year-old married woman. She is in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She hopes to increase her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment, which will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He faces a major challenge with customers taking too long to pay for goods purchased on credit. 

With the loan he is requesting, he wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Zhana

texts.en:
Zhana is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives in the Zugdidi district with her husband and 2 children. Her children go to the local kindergarten. Her husband is an artisan and gets a small monthly income. 

Zhana is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a cow and produces dairy products. She milks the cow every day and sells dairy products at a good price. Besides that, the family has 0.55 hectares of agricultural land where they grow maize, and then sell the harvested maize locally. 

Zhana wants to start a clothes trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,100 Gel to purchase a stock of used clothes. The Start Up program will be a great support for her family as she will have a stable income and will be able to improve living conditions for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading in used clothes to increase her family's income.

loans.name: Kavutha

texts.en:
Kavutha is a married woman and she has four children, all of whom attend school. Kavutha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Kavutha operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz  is a 46-year-old married woman who sells animals. She buys baby goats & calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them at higher prices. She makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Shamem

texts.en:
Shamem  is a 32-year-old married woman with 7 children. Her husband has bought and sold animals for many years. Shamem fully supports and assists her husband's  work. 

She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. She wants to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself as innovative. He has operated a dairy farm for 20 years. His business is located in an area favorable for farming and his primary customers are local people.  

He will use 70,000 KES  to buy animal feed. His business goal is to own the best breed of cows within 5 years. He hopes that in the future to buy more land. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To move into horticultural farming

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a smallholder dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She is the mother of four and has been doing crop farming, too, but for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. 

She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. As much as they have become one of the top traded agricultural products, there is still plenty of room to expand. Dorine is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. 

With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to pay the initial installments on the loan, but in no time the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Olivia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Olivia, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de Monteria, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como palitos de queso y pan de yuca.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su puesto de trabajo porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Olivia ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para realizar algunas mejoras a su sitio de trabajo y comprar materia prima como maíz, queso, entre otros.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hardworking—these are the qualities of Olivia, a fighter who has dedicated a large part of her life to taking care of her children. 

She lives in the municipality of Monteria, where she makes a living preparing a variety of foods such as "palitos de queso" (cheese sticks wrapped in dough and fried) and cassava bread. Her cooking is known by the neighbours in the area, who go to her food stall because they know that they can eat delicious food there.

Olivia has decided to improve her business and increase her sales. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to make some improvements to her food stall and buy basic ingredients such as corn and cheese, among other products.

This loan will enable her to make her business thrive so that she will have enough money to continue to support her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and make her dreams come true!

loans.use: to make some improvements to her food stall and buy basic ingredients such as corn and cheese, among other products.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married with two children, one attends school and  the other is pre-school age. He owns a house with electricity and running water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past  year, he has operated a cosmetic shop, his  customers (primarily women) are town dwellers and neighbors. He dreams of expanding his business to meet his family's basic needs. 

He will use the loan to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotion. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to increasehis business.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipstick, and body lotions.

loans.name: In God Group

texts.en:
The 'in God' Group consists of three members who live in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. They have applied for a loan of GHS 1,900 from ID-Ghana to invest in detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour), maize, vegetables, fish and ladies tops. 

Joyce is a 36-year-old married woman with three children who lives in Teshie, Accra-Ghana. She is the featured borrower. She has been selling detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour) and maize for twelve years. 

Currently, she wants to buy more detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour) and maize to sell to customers, but she doesn't have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of GHS 100 from ID-Ghana in order to purchase more detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour) and maize to sell to customers. She looks forward to improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more detergents, palm and kennel oil, gari (cassava flour) and maize to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia  is a 26-year-old married woman who works with her husband to buy and sell animals.  They have done this for many years to provide her family with a decent life. 

She has 3 children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She requests 40,000 PKR to purchase more baby goats and calves to attract customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  goats and calves.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells speakers, microwaves and other items. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of speakers, guitars and other items. Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of speakers, guitars and other items.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Neema operates a vegetable stall and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She is challenged by the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transportation business in the future. 

She will use 50,000 KES  to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Six years ago Catherine started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Chepchoina, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of one child sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale area. Catherine has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. 

Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Catherine can achieve their dreams and goals. Catherine believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. 

In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman with six children, all of whom still attend school. Her house has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

In the marketplace Salma operates a stall from which she sells fruits and vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. Her challenges include competition from other vendors and ever-variable weather.

Salma is applying for a 20,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy additional sacks of fruits such as oranges and bananas plus green vegetables to sell. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fruits such as oranges and bananas plus green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, he has operated a cereals shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. Said dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, irrigation supplies and pesticides, thus keeping his land in optimal condition for his crops

loans.name: Ngoto

texts.en:
Ngoto is a married woman and she has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 Ngoto wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 51-year-old single mother of two dependable children. The operator of an African wax-prints business for 25 years, she  is busy selling everyday and earning a good income.

Margaret is requesting a loan of GHS 1,500 to improve her enterprise through the purchase of more prints to sell.

loans.use: To buy more African wax-prints to sell

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 24-year-old hardworking woman, who makes much effort for her family's welfare. She lives in the small village of Bia with her husband, parents-in-law and daughter. The family members are involved in agricultural activity, which is the main source of income. 

Particularly, Lali and her husband take care of 2 horses and a plot of agricultural land where nuts and laurel are grown. However, the family doesn't generate enough income to meet even basic needs and cover all daily costs, so they live in poverty and require additional income for their well-being. 

Because of this situation, Lali requested a loan for starting a retail business with sheep at the local market. Her attempt was unsuccessful the first time, because of her family's poor living conditions. 

The Start Up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, gives a chance to poor people to start or re-start businesses. The loan will be a great support to this hardworking woman and her family, enabling her to generate additional income and easily cover everyday expenses.
 
Lali and her family rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will appreciate their help and kindness.

loans.use: To start a retail business with sheep and increase her income.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida  is a 41-year-old married, working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and provide for their education. 

Abida has a good reputation among her neighbors for her collections and has a good customer base. She needs 40,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors. This would help her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality fabric of different colors.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia  is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children, who has sold milk for many years. She has buffalo and sells the milk in her area. Her business earns enough profit to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation and requests 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales.  She wants to provide  better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a female Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined and honest. She operates a chemist's shop where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for 2 years.

Sharon's business is located in an area with potential for business growth, and her primary customers are her regulars. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate funds. She hopes that in the future she will have increased income. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years.

This is Sharon's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy more medicine for her inventory.

loans.use: buy more medicine for her inventory.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Caroline does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Kitale area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with 4 children. 

For the past 3 years, Caroline has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques.

She keeps poultry for eggs and grows maize and vegetables for sale. She also engages in small businesses on the side whenever an opportunity crosses her path. Despite the rapid fluctuation of prices in the market, Caroline is very passionate and optimistic about the future of horticultural farming in Kenya. 

She is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. This move is quite a big deal for her. With your loan, Caroline seeks to continue growing different varieties of crops but on a greater scale. The demand for vegetables and other greens in Kitale and other parts of the country is very high.

Income from this venture will negate the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs. She stated, “In the future, I will be able to provide food for my family and also educate my children.”

loans.use: To start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Yudy Andrea

texts.es:
Yudy es una mujer de campo y madre de 1 hijo por el que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de cerdos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos cerdos para cría ya que tiene un corral alquilado para albergarlos allí.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y su hijo.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Yudy is a countrywoman and mother to a son for whom she has had to go through many adversities in life. However, she has always had the strength to move on and continue to progress with her family. For some time now she has wanted to set up a business of rearing and selling pigs. 

It is for this reason that she asks for a financial encouragement to buy some pigs for rearing as she has already rented a pigpen to house them.  

With this new business she will be able to generate income for her family, improving the quality of life of her husband and son, who mean everything to her. 

She will work every day to drive her business forward and make it a sustainable and profitable activity. Support this hardworking woman with a loan!

loans.use: To purchase some pigs for rearing as she has already rented a pigpen to house them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many different kinds of food items.

loans.name: Immtiaz

texts.en:
Immtiaz  is a 27-year-old married woman with 3 children. She is an energetic lady who has operated a fabric business for many years. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to  her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money. 

She requests 60,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Immtiaz  expects an increase in her earnings  and plans to spend her profits to better  family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Rehmat  is a 57-year-old, married woman. She is been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her town. She has a strong customer base. 

Rehmat  has requested 40,000 PKR to buy a variety of cloth for her business to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer from Nigeria. He has 3 children.

A loan from Kiva helps him to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, Shehu had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as clothing, food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

When asked, Shehu said: “ I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope they will have professional jobs."

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and store his harvest to sell it later in the year at higher prices

loans.name: Audu

texts.en:
Audu is a maize farmer from Nigeria.

A loan from Kiva helps him to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, Audu had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

When asked, Audu voiced his ambition to become one of the most profitable farmers in his community.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and store his harvest to sell it later in the year at higher prices

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has a sari-sari store in her village. Her husband is a farmer who grows corn and pineapple in their field. Gina sells beverages, noodles, cheese curls, cooked snacks and candies. Most of her costumers are students because her stall is near a school. Gina’s store has been in operation for 12 years now. She wishes to run the business while she can manage it. Gina is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy various grocery items to sell. She will also use the loan to buy raw ingredients for cooking snack foods to sell. She hopes to gain more costumers and gain more income as well.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Jay Maa Santoshi Shg Group

texts.en:
Chanchala is a 58-year-old widow woman. She has two children who are 24 and 29 years old and works selling vegetables at retail. 

Chanchala is enterprising, independent, a good mother, tenacious, courageous and hardworking. She works in the Dhenkanal town of Odisha. Her native language is Odia. She lives independently with her children, who also work with her. They live in a rented brick house, which has electricity and water.

To expand her business, Chanchala formed a group of people so she could apply for a loan and improve her business. The group runs businesses such as selling clothing, fruit, tomatoes, milk items and fish; running a sewing workshop, a clothing workshop and a construction service.

Chanchala sells vegetables at retail. The vendor of vegetables comes to her selling point to deliver great quantities of different types of vegetables, which she displays and sells in large quantities. This is her first loan cycle with the People’s Forum. Her dream is to expand her business by making a vegetable vending point. 

Chanchala will use her loan portion to make an improved display area for vegetables.

loans.use: to make an improved display area for vegetables.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with two children, all attend school. They live at their own house that is without electricity and running water. 

She has operated a home-based fresh water selling business for the past three years.  She is challenged by in-climate weather especially during the rainy season when business is low. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase a water tank and install aa water tap for her business. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and install a water tap for her business.

loans.name: Lawizan

texts.en: Lawizan , 43 years old, is a very enthusiastic person who has successfully run a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Lawizan  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested 50,000 PKR  to buy  oil, milk, sugar, and juiceto consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy oil, milk, sugar, and juice.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is 37-year-old married woman with 5 children, who has sold milk for many years, with the help of her husband. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has 3 buffalo and sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.  It’s her 6th year with Kashf Foundation and she needs 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. 

She is hopeful that her business will expand with the help of this loan and she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Nigeria. 

A loan from Kiva helps him to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store his harvest to sell it later at a higher price

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a maize farmer from Nigeria. 

A loan from Kiva helps her to purchase fertilizer for her crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable her to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  she had to sell her maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as clothing and food. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, she can now store her maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows her to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store her harvest to sell it later at a higher price

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a Nigerian maize farmer.

A loan from Kiva helps him to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as clothing food (and school fees). With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris has a retail shop in Thika town and has been running this business for two years. She is 32 years old, married and together with her spouse has been blessed with two children. 

Damaris will use this loan to buy more stock of goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice and sugar to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is Damaris's fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to expand her business, make more income and be able to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods such as flour, cooking fat, rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of timber

loans.name: Maa Tarini Shg Group

texts.en:
Rama, age 40, resides in the Dhenkanal district of Odisha. She is a single mother and lives with her parents and children in Ghatipiri village in a small house. In the daytime, she supports her parents in the agricultural activities of the family. 

She also is the leader of the Maa Tarini Self-Help Group of her village. The members of the community decided to take up loans for financially supporting their families. They take up alternate income-generating activities, which would help them in contributing to their household income. 

Rama wanted to support her family in agriculture by growing additional cash crops, such as turmeric and chilies, in addition to the paddy and other crops they rely on. These crops are in high demand in the market, and the area is known for its high quality of turmeric. 

She has requested a loan of 150,000 INR for her SHG, so each one of them can take up such activities to support their families. She will use her portion to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her family's farmland.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for her family's farmland.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house, which has electricity and piped water.

Doreen has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan 20,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a maize farmer from Nigeria. He is the father of 3 children.

A loan from Kiva helps him to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona,  he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and store his harvest to sell it later at higher prices

loans.name: Jhoseline

texts.es: Jhoseline es una mujer sola que no tiene dependientes Ella vive en La Paz, en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler pero al menos vive con relativa comodidad. Jhoseline se gana la vida vendiendo cables y otros artículos de ferretería. La clienta solicita un prestamo para comprar mayor cantidad de articulos de ferreteria para una tienda que posee en anticretico, es decir, un limitado periodo de tiempo (en su caso es 4 años) Jhoseline es independiente y no tiene a nadie que pueda apoyarla (ni siquiera cuenta con la ayuda de sus padres) por eso ella espera su colaboracion.
texts.en:
Jhoseline is single, with no children, and makes a living selling wires and other hardware items. She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house that she rents but offers relative comfort. Jhoseline is applying for a loan to purchase hardware items for her shop. She has a four-year lease on the shop, an arrangement that under Bolivian law requires her to pay all rent up front, but requires the owner to repay all rent at the end of the lease. 

Jhoseline is independent and has no one to support her, though her parents help her. She is therefore waiting for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quanity hardware items.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman and has been blessed with children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

For the past four years, Josephine has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Josephine is requesting 40,000 KES to boost her kiosk, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Riziki wants to start a vegetable stall. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
Lilian operated a vegetable selling stall for three years.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has been blessed with kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

Beatrice operated a food selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Beatrice dreams of becoming a wholesaler of cooked food in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, sugar and food colors for food preparation. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat floor, sugar and food colors for food preparation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new refrigerator for the house.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es: Rosa de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de elote desde hace 23 años, adicional a eso vende frutas y verduras, tiene muchos clientes por ser un alimento muy vendible, Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  elotes por mayor y leche para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos
texts.en: Rosa is a 38-year-old single mother who lives with her three children in the family's own home. She has worked preparing and selling corn tamales for 23 years, and also sells fruits and vegetables. Rosa has a large customer base as there is great demand for her food. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of wholesale ears of corn and milk so that she can continue her work, which is her only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale ears of corn and milk

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Hello lenders!  Meet Leah. She is 44 years old. She comes from Litein, which is a town in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Leah is a smallholder farmer who keeps dairy cattle and poultry. She is also an entrepreneur engaged in other small personal businesses. For the two years that Leah has been doing farming, she finds milking to be the most enjoyable activity. However, she doesn't enjoy cleaning the dairy unit as much. There is no doubting her deep connection to farm animals, as she names and occasionally talks to her animals.
