“I will like to use this additional income to educate my children" Rahila said. " I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and store her harvest to sell it later for more profit

loans.name: Isalha

texts.en:
Isalha is a maize farmer from Nigeria. He is the father of three children.

A loan from Kiva helps Isalha to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows him to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and store his harvest to sell it later for more profit

loans.name: Philibus Yayo

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Nigeria. He is the father of 3 children.

A loan from Kiva helps Philibus to purchase fertilizer for his crops and also to obtain a training course in agronomy and business. This will enable him to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize - double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. 

Also, before joining Babban Gona, he had to sell his maize at low prices soon after harvest in order to pay for urgent expenses, such as food and school fees. With the Kiva loan and Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize at harvest and sell it later at prices up to 40% higher. 

This allows Philibus to generate earnings of up to $1,000/hectare, more than four times Nigerian farmers' annual income.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and store his harvest to sell it later for more profits

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de camarones vende de forma ambulantes por las comunidades que están cerca de su casa y posee muchos clientes, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas camarones por mayor para continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The young man, whose face is pixelated because he is 22 years old and he lives in a high risk zone, makes a living from the sale of shrimp.  He sells itinerantly throughout the communities close to his house and he has lots of customers.  The young man lives in his own home with his life companion.  
He is requesting a loan to buy more shrimp wholesale in order to continue his work since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy shrimp wholesale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
BeatrIce, who is in her mid 50s, is married with five children, two of whom are still in school but the other three are grown ups. She has been running a spare parts shop since 2005. She works from 9am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Beatrice's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase stock of spares and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, saved some in her bank account, and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to buy the fast turnover spares in her shop to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of having her house renovated by repainting it.

Beatrice will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her shop to meet her customers'  demands.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a  47 year-old male, married with seven children and living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has owned a photo studio for eight years now. He has managed to educate his children and look after his family. Fred has a dream of educating his children. 

He is a hard-working man faced with the challenge of competition. Fred is requesting a loan to buy a camera and a computer for editing photos.

loans.use: to buy a camera and a computer for editing photos

loans.name: Ismael Humberto

texts.es: Ismael de 40 años de edad desde hace varios años se dedica a la crianza de ganado en la zona donde reside, tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, Ismael  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio, por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y la compra de mas ganado que le permita crecer en el negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Ismael is 40 years of age and has made a living for several years raising livestock in the area where he lives. He has a very good customer-base because he knows how to gain the trust of his clients. He lives in his own home with his partner and daughter. Ismael has decided to invest in caring for his livestock because his business depends on it. For this reason, he has requested a loan to buy vitamins and more livestock, which will allow the business to grow so that he can receive a better income.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and more livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Vereryano

texts.en:
Vereryano is a 65-year-old man, married with two children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been growing and selling bananas for many years in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from selling banana juice. He started his business to diversify his income to look after his children. 

Vereryano is faced with lack of capital to expand his banana plantation and to control banana wilt disease. He is requesting for a loan to improve his banana plantation by pruning and mulching.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by pruning and mulching.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married and is a five-time customer with UGAFODE Microfonance. She used the previous loan to buy sodas and beers in bulk which boosted her sales. She will use this loan to purchase a freezer. She will then keep her drinks in excellent conditions to offer her clients good-quality products. She will equip her business to keep it running and generate earnings to comply with her various obligations.

Her dream is to improve her financial situation so that she will be able to cover her needs and those of her child. She thanks UGAFODE for the support.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino is a business man specializing in coffee trading. He is an old client who has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000  to buy coffee for his business. He also has a retail shop where he works seven hours a day and six days a week. He started his business in the year 1999 in a rural setting, but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. 

The business is carried out from the Karangara, Mitooma District. His customers are people in Mitooma district and their continued support and his tireless effort have helped his business to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income to cater to his family's needs. His major challenge in the business is price fluctuation, but he is ready to grow through his hard work. He hopes to be financially stable and build a beautiful house. Pictured is Paulino and his wife.

loans.use: to buy coffee for trade.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio está en su 1ºciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante para un bienestar propio y para su familia por conservar un bienestar.
 Una mujer que se destaca es la Sra. Carmen, quien es la presidenta, ella comenta que trata siempre de motivas a sus compañeras para poder dar a su familia todo para una vida digna y sin privavciones. Ella es costurera, tiene un taller modesto en el que trabaja todos los dias desde muy tempranas horas, tiene muchos pedidos que le permiten ganarse la vida de una manera honrada.
Pide este prestamo para comprar telas e hilos en cantidad, para poder seguir con su costura como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its first cycle of the women's committee program, in which all women work and help one another to get ahead for their own welfare and to ensure the well-being of their families.

One woman who stands out is Carmen, who is the president.  She comments that she tries to always motivate her fellow members to try to give their families everything so they can live a decent life which doesn't lack for anything. She is a seamstress and she has a modest workshop where she works everyday, starting very early in the morning. She has many orders, which allow her to earn an honest living. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric and thread in bulk, so that she can continue with her sewing as she has been doing.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 24 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 1 child. He makes construction bricks for sale. He also has a motorcycle transport business and has been in this business for 4 years and it has been profitable. 

He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts and be able to service his motorcycle so it can be in good condition. This will enable him to serve more customers and get more income, which he will use to build a brick house for making more bricks to sell. 

This is Paul's second loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. His future hopes are to be successful in his business, make more income and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for servicing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Josicah

texts.en:
Josicah is 45 years old. She is married and together with her husband they have been blessed with eight children between 22 and 7 years old.

Josicah runs a grocery store business that she has done for the last two years earning a monthly income of KES 7,500. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 15,000, which she will use to add to her stock of assorted vegetables for resale.

With the anticipated profits, Josicah will be able to buy more vegetable stock as well as repay her loan. 

Josicah's hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale grocery store for vegetables and fruits as well as repay her loan.

loans.use: to add to her stock of assorted vegetables for resale

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey, age 32 years, has been a known business man at Karama, Bushenyi district with electronic and phone accessories since 2009. He has managed to sustain his family of one child and wife. He also operates a men’s saloon on a daily basis. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more stock of phone chargers and batteries for his business. 

He is a hardworking man who works for 10 hours a day and 6 days a week. His clients are people of all categories since the majority of the population is now connected with mobile phones. His major challenge though is limited capital to operate his business, but hopes to have it sorted out after getting a loan to boost his business. He hopes to be financially stable for a better future.

loans.use: To buy phone chargers and batteries for his electronics shop

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 30 years old and lives in the town of Lira in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, one of whom is currently in school. 

For the past 3 years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells posho (a cornmeal porridge), rice, beans, salt, soda drinks, bananas, bread, and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more of the items he sells in his shop and will also help Patrick to generate greater profits. Patrick hopes that, in the future, he will be able to expand his business. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his shop such as posho, rice, beans, salt, soda, bananas, bread, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Fred Silver

texts.en:
Fred Silver is 36 years old, and lives in the town of Kumi in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 8 years, Fred Silver has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells groundnuts and beans. 

To help expand his business, Fred Silver has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans and groundnuts, and will help Fred Silver to generate greater profits and buy piece of land. Fred Silver hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Fred Silver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred Silver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beans and groundnuts

loans.name: Mapilahon

texts.ru: Мапилахон 49 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Мапилахон - среднее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, Мапилахон 4 года назад стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мапилахон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1 корова. Также есть земельный надел мерою 0,51 Га, где она выращивает картофель и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мапилахон обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы, семян картофеля и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Мапилахон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины. Также она мечтает накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mapilahon is 49 years old, married, and the mother of  four children. She has the equivalent of a high school education.  Four years ago, she became involved in animal husbandry and agriculture as she was looking for an additional source of income for her family.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns one cow and she uses 0.51 hectare of allotted land on which she grows potatoes and corn for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further grow her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy an additional cow, as well as some potato seeds and fertilizers, in order to prepare the soil for cultivation.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further increasing her cattle headcount.  She is also dreaming about saving enough money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase one cow, as well as potato seeds and fertilizers to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Sr. Jorge es el menor de dos hermanos, el mismo desde hace cuatro años tiene a su cargo junto con su madre la Sra. Adolfina un desarmadero de vehículos, que con mucho sacrificio han logrado salir adelante. Cuenta con 3 personales a su servicio, compran repuestos usados como llantas, motores, amortiguadores, cilindros, carretas entre otros para su posterior venta. Además fabrica carreta para motocarro y porta bultos de autos.
Su deseo es poder montar un local el centro de la cuidad y así poder crecer más en el mercado. Pide este préstamo para la compra de repuestos usados, como llantas, amortiguadores, motores, etc.
texts.en:
Jorge is the younger of two brothers.  For four years, he himself along with his mother Adolfina have been in charge of an automobile wrecking yard, in which they have achieved progress with much sacrifice.  He has three employees in his service and they buy used parts like tires, motors, mufflers, cylinders, and carts among other things for subsequent sale.  He also makes carts for three wheelers and cargo carriers for automobiles.  
His wish is to have a shop in the center of the city and thus be able to grow more in the market.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy used parts such as tires, mufflers, motors, etc.

loans.use: to buy used parts such as tires, mufflers, motors, etc.

loans.name: Leonardo José

texts.es:
Leonardo, a sus 19 años de edad, es un hombre carismático, activo y servicial. 
Ser independiente, fue el principal motivo para luchar incansablemente día a día, buscando alternativas para ganarse la vida y colaborar con los gastos de su hogar. 

Desde hace aproximadamente 6 años, comenzó a fabricar y comercializar calzado para todo tipo de clientes, de muy buena calidad y a excelentes precios, lo que le permitió darse a conocer en el sector donde vive. 

Esto lo impulsa a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para fortalecer su actividad pues con el dinero comprara materia prima como suelas, pegas y cuero para continuar con su fabricación de calzado, le ayudará a mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Leonardo manifiesta que su edad no le impide hacer lo que le apasiona, por ello siempre se propone nuevas metas y entre ellas está el de convertirse en un gran distribuidor de calzado y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el bienestar tanto de su familia, como la de aquellas personas que le ayuden a realizar su labor diaria.
texts.en:
Leonardo, at his 19 years of age, is an active, helpful and charismatic man.  Being independent was his main reason for struggling tirelessly every day, looking for alternative ways to earn a living and help with the household expenses.  About 6 years ago, he began to make and sell shoes for all kinds of customers, of very good quality and at excellent prices, which allowed him to come to be known in the area where he lives.  This is driving him to request the support of a loan in order to strengthen his business, since with the money he will buy raw materials like soles, glues and leather to continue making shoes.  It will help him to improve the income he gets from his work. 

Leonardo states that his age doesn’t stop him from doing what he loves.  For that reason he is always setting new goals for himself; among them is to become a large distributor of footwear and generate employment opportunities.  In this way he will be able to improve the quality of life and well being as much for his family as for those people who would help him carry out his daily work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like soles, glues and leather to continue making shoes.

loans.name: San Ramon Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Ramon  esta formado por 22 integrantes, está en  el 3°ciclo   del programa de comités de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rut , quien en la encuesta que se le practicó esta en el nivel 3, lo que quiere decir que está mejorando poco a poco a  través del esfuerzo y por medio de la chipa que ella hace. La chipa es un producto típico paraguayo que se come en todo momento.
La Sra. Rut Solicita este préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de chipa para poder venderlo y así seguir luchando por mejorar como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The San Ramon group is formed by 22 members. It is in the 3rd cycle  of the Women Committee Program in which all are putting forth their best effort to help each other. One of the members is Rut. She is in the 3rd level, which says that she is moving up little-by-little through  her efforts to sell the chipa she makes. Chipa is a typical Paraguayan product that is eaten at all times. Rut is applying for the loan in order to buy a large amount of chipa so that she can sell it and continue striving to improve as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy chipa to sell.

loans.name: Ann Grace

texts.en:
Ann Grace is 24 years old, and she lives in the Lira region of Uganda, in the town of Kumi. Ann Grace is married and has 2 children, neither of whom are in school yet. 

Over the past 2 years Ann Grace has worked hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells posho (a kind of cornmeal porridge), beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, and salt. 

To help Ann Grace expand her business, she has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings. She will use the loan to buy more supplies of posho, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, and salt. This will help Ann Grace to increase both her profits and capital. Ann Grace hopes to grow her business in the future.    

Ann Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ann Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to supply her shop with posho, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, and salt.

loans.name: Janephepher

texts.en:
Janephepher is a 44-year-old woman married to Allan, who adds additional income to support their family; they are blessed with four children.  Janepherpher has been a tailor for a period of five years, earning herself an income of KES. 10,000 at the end of every month.

She is now servicing her second loan of KES. 45,000 with VisionFund Kenya, and intends to use this amount to buy a sewing machine and textile materials.

Janephepher plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees of her children. She hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and textile materials.

loans.name: Satade

texts.en:
Satade is 31 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married, and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past year, Satade has been working hard to manage his shoe sale business, selling shoes. 

To help expand his business, Satade has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Satade to generate greater profits and increase income. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Satade is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Satade who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Amado De Jesus

texts.es:
Amado es un humilde vendedor de víveres y productos en general de la canasta familiar que logro construir un pequeño rancho con madera y cartón como se puede apreciar en la foto, vende en el sector de Santa fe de Antioquia y su sueño es trabajar para mejorar su ingresos y así poder construir su tienda en material ya que un ventarrón o una situación climática de un nivel considerado puede arrasar con su tienda dejándolo en la calle. 
Solicita un crédito para comprar insumos y surtir su tienda, de la misma manera comprara materiales para ir construyendo su local y hacerlo más seguro.
Sueña con seguir con el negocio ya que con este puede darle a su pareja y sus hijo una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Amado is a humble salesman selling groceries and assorted goods in a grocery store that he constructed in a small shed made of wood and cardboard as you can see in the picture. He sells  in a part of Santa Fe de Antioquia. His dream is to improve his income and be able to construct his store from solid material since strong winds or large meteorological events could raze his store and level it in the street. He is applying for a loan to buy basic goods, stock his store, and buy materials to reconstruct his store and make it more secure. He dreams of continuing with this business since he would give his partner and their son a better quality-of-life with it.

loans.use: to buy basic goods and construct his business from a sturdier material since it's made of cardboard and he risks losing it all.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with one kid, who currently attends school. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Jackline's greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Jackline operates a vegetable retail stall, where she sells fresh vegetables at the local market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of business. Jackline dreams of expanding in the future and establishing a motorcycle transport business.

With the 25,000 KES loan, Jackline wishes to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions to sell at her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Apontius

texts.en:
Apontius is 48 years old and lives in the town of Rukungiri, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married, and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past year, Apontius has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho, beans, ground nuts, and Irish potatoes. 

To help expand his business, Apontius has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, and cooking oil.  This will help Apontius to generate greater profits and increase working capital. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Apontius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Apontius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Banada

texts.en:
Banada is 56 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo, in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Banada has been working hard to manage his farming business, which deals in banana farming. 

To help expand his business, Banada has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, and will help Banada to generate greater profits and get more profits. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Banada is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Banada who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Los Volcanes Group

texts.es: Grupo los Volcanes está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Norma de 62 años de edad, viuda, emprendedora y su negocio es venta de refrescos, helados, repostería y hielo desde hace ocho años, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas, pan simple, pan dulce, pan mixto, frutas para helados, azúcar, etc. Una de las metas de la socia es superarse y lo ha logrado con los créditos anteriores, ya que ha obtenido una mejor estabilidad económica. Doña Ignacia tiene 66 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de nacatamales desde hace 25 años; Y la tercera socia es Jessica tiene 22 años de edad y su negocio es la comercialización de ropa.
texts.en: Los Volcanes group is formed by three hard-working and successful members. One of them is 62-year-old Norma. She is a hard-working widow and she has sold soda, ice cream, desserts, and ice for 8 years. She will incest the loan in the purchase of bags, simple breads, sweet breads, mixed breads, fruits for ice cream, sugar, etc. One of the member's goals is to get ahead and she has done so with previous loans as she has become more economically stable. Ignacia is 66 years old and she has sold nacatamales for 25 years. The third member is 22-year-old Jessica who sells clothes.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for making drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal to supply his neighbors since her will be the only distributor in the area.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen  is a married man and has children. He lives at his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family, and school fees for his kids.

For the past four years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the  high cost of transportation, and he dreams of expanding and establishing a wholesale boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting of Kes 100,000, he wants to purchase three bales of clothes and some shoes to sell to expand his business. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes and some shoes to expand his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her business and living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Xavier

texts.en:
Xavier is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Xavier has been working hard to manage his salon, which deals in hairdressing. 

To help expand his business, Xavier has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy machines for cutting hair, and will help Xavier to generate greater profits and buy better equipment. Xavier hopes that in the future, he will be able to enlarge to a beauty parlour. 

Xavier is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Xavier who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy machines for cutting hair

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Annet has been working hard to manage her general store, which sells plates, flasks and saucepans. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more plates, flasks and saucepans, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and stock the shop. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more plates, flasks and saucepans

loans.name: Benah

texts.en:
Benah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Benah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells posho, maize flour, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, salt, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Benah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase  posho, maize flour, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, salt, and soap, and will help Benah to generate greater profits and increase stock. Benah hopes that in the future, she will be able to transform to a supermarket. 

Benah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase posho, maize flour, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, salt, and soap

loans.name: Ishaka

texts.en:
Ishaka is 46 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, with three of them currently in school. For the past 16 years, Ishaka has been working hard to manage his farming. He owns a banana farm. 

To help expand his business, Ishaka has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more banana seedlings, and will help Ishaka to generate greater profits and improve his family’s well being. Ishaka hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand the business. 

Ishaka is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ishaka who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more banana seedlings.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabale, in the Kabale region of Uganda. He is married and has four children; three of them are currently in school. For the past eight years Patrick has been working hard to manage his drinks business, which sells beer, soda, and local native porridge. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy drinks and flour, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and improve his family's well-being. Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy drinks and flour.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita trabaja como cocinera junto a su cuñada y quiere un prestamo para compra de una maquina que le permita cocinar pollos a la broaster Ya que el sueño de Benita es independizarse Benita es casada, tiene 5 hijos, vive en La Paz en una casa de adobe donde ella es la propietaria La familia vive con comodidad El esposo trabaja como mecanico pero hay muchos gastos cuando se tiene 5 hijos por lo que Benita espera su ayuda, ella goza de buena salud y esta ansiosa por sacar adelante su propio negocio
texts.en: Benita works as a cook with her sister-in-law and wants a loan to buy a machine that will enable her to cook chickens broaster style. Benita dreams of being self-sufficient. She is married, has 5 children, lives in La Paz in an adobe house she owns.  The family lives comfortably. Her husband works as a mechanic but there are many expenses with 5 children which is why Benita hopes to help. She enjoys good health and is anxious to move her business forward.

loans.use: to buy a machine that will enable her to cook chickens broaster style.

loans.name: Josias

texts.es:
Josias tiene 33 años de edad, es separado, tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Vive con sus hijos y su madre de avanzada edad, en el centro poblado de Piquijaca, distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de lima el de mayor producción, así como al comercio. Piquijaca es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse.

Josias se dedica a la agricultura cuenta con terreno propio en el caserío de Piquijaca en donde cuenta con una finca de lima frutera, la cual se encuentra en buen estado, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, ademas el cliente cuenta con un bar restaurante en dicho caserío, por su buen servicio cuenta con bastante clientela en la zona, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas, entre otros para poder asegurar que la campaña 2015 obtendrá excelente cosecha. Invirtiendo en su negocio Josias podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Josias is 33 years old, separated, and has two dependent children.  He lives with his children and his elderly mother in the town of Piquijaca in the San Felipe district, Jaen province, and Cajamarca province in the northern mountains of Peru.  In his town, the people work in agriculture, mostly planting limes, and in commerce.  Piquijaca is a mid-sized town that wants to improve itself.

Josias works as a farmer and has his own land in the town of Piquijaca where he has a lime crop.  His farm is in good condition and he has more than 10 years of experience in this area.  He also owns a bar restaurant in town.  His good service has earned him many customers in the area.  He has good personal and work references.

He is requesting this loan to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticides, among other items.  This will ensure that the 2015 season will have a good harvest.  By investing in his business, Josias will be able to earn good profits so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure, fertilizer, and insecticides.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a married woman; she has children, all of whom attend school. Veronicah owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Veronicah operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood and charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.es:
Mercedez es una mujer de 38 años de edad, soltera, tiene tres hijos de cinco, nueve y once años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es buena madre, responsable, trabajadora, constante y de buen trato al cliente. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en distintas ferias de su ciudad.
Mercedez es de tez morena, estatura mediana cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Quechua que ya no práctica y habla español por el comercio. Su vida la realiza con sus tres hijos; los dos mayores estudian en la escuela, el menor entrará a la escuela el próximo año, viven en una casa de ladrillo propia y cuentan con electricidad y agua potable. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de temporada de forma ambulante en distintas ferias de su ciudad, actividad que viene realizando desde hace cuatro años. Este es su segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución anteriormente solicitó un préstamo para aumentar su capital, comenta que le fue bien y pudo lograr sus metas. Su sueño es tener un negocio estable en un puesto fijo de venta. Ella desea aprovechar las ventas de fin de año realizando la compra de ropa de temporada por mayor para mejorar sus ingresos económicos y solventar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Mercedez solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año y solventar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedez, 38, is a single woman with three children, 5, 9, and 11, and her business is clothing sales.  She is a good mother, responsible, hard-working, constant, and treats her customers well.  She carries out her work itinerantly in the various open air markets of her city.
Mercedez is of brown complexion, medium height, and has long black hair.  Her mother tongue is Quechua which she no longer uses and she speaks Spanish because of her work.  She shares her life with her three children: the two oldest study in school and the youngest will start school next year.  They live in her own brick house which has electricity and drinking water.  Her business is seasonal clothing sales which she does itinerantly in the various open air markets in her city, an activity which she has been doing for four years.
This is her second sequence of loans from the institution.  Previously, she requested a loan to increase her capital.  She says it went well and she achieved her goals.  Her dream is to have a stable business in a fixed sales location.  She wishes to take advantage of the year end sales by buying seasonal clothing wholesale in order to increase her economic income and cover the school expenses of her children.
It is for these reasons that Mercedez is requesting a loan to buy wholesale clothing in order to take advantage of the year end sales and cover the school expenses of her kids.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing in order to take advantage of the year end sales and cover the school expenses of her children.

loans.name: El Plan Group

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 44 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 10 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es constante, activa, responsable, buena madre y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona sur de su ciudad, caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura aproximada de 30 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Sonia es de tez morena, cabello largo rojizo ondulado, su lengua materna es el quechua y habla español por el comercio (sentada, polera verde). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica al transporte como taxi y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela. La necesidad por mejorar su calidad de vida la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de construcción, elaboración de colchones, venta de empanadas, venta de pescado, comercio de cosméticos, venta de ropa de temporada, tejido a máquina y servicio técnicos de electrodomésticos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la panadería, ella cuenta con un horno industrial, entre los productos que ofrece, tiene los siguiente grupos;  Panadería (pan de arroz, cuñapes (pan de queso), arepas(pan de yuca)), repostería (roscas de maíz, bizcocho de maíz) y pastelería (de chocolate y vainilla). Sus productos son vendidos de forma ambulante y también cuenta con clientes habituales como tiendas y oficinas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva en su negocio. Su sueño es tener una panadería amplia y surtida. Ella desea realizar una inversión realizando la compra de harina y otros ingredientes por mayor, para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año y que no le falte materia prima para trabajar.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año sin que le falte materia prima para trabajar.
texts.en:
Sonia is 44 years old, lives with her husband, has two children ages 14 and 10, and she has a bakery business. She is reliable, active, responsible, hard-working and a good mother. Her business is located in the southern area of the city, an area known for a variety of businesses. This region enjoys a warm tropical climate with a temperature of approximately 30 degrees centigrade all year round.

Sonia has a dark complexion, long wavy hair, her first language is Quechua and she speaks Spanish for business. In the photo she is seated, wearing the green shirt. Her husband is a taxi drive and her two children are in school. The need to improve her quality of life inspired her to form a communal bank, and the members represent businesses such as: construction, selling seasonal clothing, machine weaving, appliance repair. They seek a loan to better their businesses.

Sonia's business is a bakery. She has an industrial oven, and among the products she offers are bread (rice bread, cheese bread), arepas (yuca bread), pastries (corn rings, corn cake), and cakes (chocolate and vanilla). She sells her products as a street vendor and also to regular customers in stores and offices.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the year she has her business. Her dream is to have an expansive and well-stocked bakery. She wants a loan to buy flour at wholesale to take advantage of the end of years sales without worrying about not having ingredients for her work.

loans.use: to buy flour at wholesale to take advantage of the end of years sales without worrying about not having ingredients for her work.

loans.name: German Amilcar

texts.es:
German  de 39 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, es mecánico estudio hasta octavo grado, está acompañado y su compañera de vida es comerciante de productos comestibles.  Actualmente no tiene hijos.
Él se dedica al servicio de mecánica, lo cual le genera buenos ingresos, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad esto lo aprendió con un amigo que tiene un taller, trabaja todos los días desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tuercas, compresor, cables, soplete, pintura, etc. Le hacen falta para poder desempeñar de forma más eficiente su trabajo,  lo cual espera que sea de gran apoyo ya que con eso podrá trabajar más,  para poder generar mayores ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
German is a 39 year old hardworking man. He's a mechanic and studied through 8th grade. He's partnered and his life partner sells food products. Currently, they don't have children.

He earns a living as a mechanic, which earns a good income. He's been doing this work for more than 20 years and learned it with a friend who had a workshop. He works everyday from 7am-5pm.

The loan he's seeking is to buy nuts, a compressor, cables, a torch, paints, etc.  - things he's lacking to be able to do his job more efficiently. He hopes these will be a big help, and with this he'll be able to work more to earn a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy nuts, a compressor, cables, a torch, paints, etc. to be able to do his work more efficiently.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en: Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Edinah, a youthful, 24-year-old mum, who is the mother of four good-looking children. She is based in Waitaluk, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This is an area with high poultry production and consumption. For five years Edinah has been actively involved in mixed farming as a source of income. She has a beautiful and supportive man, who helps her with farm work and domestic chores. Her primary sources of income are milk, crops, and some personal business that she does to make ends meet. She passionately loves poultry farming, and this can be noticed in how she takes good care of her poultry birds and feeds them. When she was asked what she enjoys about poultry farming, she replied that she enjoys “picking up the eggs every day in the morning.” However, this humble and honest mum faces challenges of not meeting the demand for eggs, and not satisfying her ever-increasing client base. That is why she is requesting a loan -- to buy good quality breeds of poultry birds. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture, and the demand for chicken is always high, because it is such a popular meal for so many people. In addition to earning increased profits, Edinah will benefit from poultry manure, which will save her some money that she otherwise would have used to buy fertilizer. With the increased income from selling eggs, poultry meat, and feathers, she will permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es: Rodrigo es soltero, tiene 22 años pero tiene la responsabilidad de mantener a una hija pequeña. Rodrigo vive con sus padres en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus progenitores, asimismo, todos los integrantes de la casa viven con comodidad. Rodrigo gana dinero como guardia de seguridad pero desea un credito para estudiar una carrera a nivel tecnico para poder mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su hija Rodrigo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar  pero goza de buena salud y tiene muchas ganas de superarse
texts.en: Rodrigo is single, 22 years old, with the responsibility of supporting a small daughter. Rodrigo lives with his parents in La Paz in a brick and cement house that belongs to his parents. All the members of the family live comfortably in the house. Rodrigo earns money as a security guard but wants a loan to study a technical career in order to improve his income and quality of life of his daughter. Rodrigo is the only source of income in his home but enjoys good health and has the drive to be successful.

loans.use: to study a technical career.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy oils, braids, and a generator. It will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and improve the well-being of the family. Sylvia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy oils, braids, and a generator

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es:
María de 37 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijas, ambas estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta 4° grado de educación básica, al ser una de las hermanas mayores tuvo que dejar el estudio para dedicarse al negocio familiar.

María es comerciante, vende productos de primera necesidad y medicina natural, tiene  años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio que lo tiene montado en su casa. El préstamo lo necesita para terminar de ampliar y remodelar su casa porque está construyendo dos habitaciones para sus hijas, también comprara productos para su tienda.

María se proyecta ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio para que los fines de semana pueda vender pupusas.
texts.en:
Maria, 37, is married and has two daughters, both of whom study in the community school.  She could only study up to the fourth grade of basic education.  Being one of the older sisters, she had to leave her studies to make a living in the family business.
Maria is a merchant.  She sells products of primary necessity and natural medicine.  She has years of experience in this type of business which she runs out of her house.  She needs the loan to finish expanding and remodeling her house because she is building two bedrooms for her daughters.  She will also buy products for her shop.
Maria has plans to expand the infrastructure of her business so she can sell pupusas (stuffed tortillas) on the weekend.

loans.use: to finish expanding and remodeling her house and to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Ploce Agnes

texts.en:
Ploce Agnes is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kabale in the Kabale region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. For the past five years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread and cooking oil.

To help expand her business, Ploce Agnes has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread and cooking oil, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve the family's well being. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

Ploce Agnes is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ploce Agnes who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread and cooking oil.

loans.name: Gaston

texts.en:
Gaston is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Gaston has been working hard to manage his timber sales business. 

To help expand his business, Gaston has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy timber, and will help Gaston to generate greater profits and improve his standards of living. Gaston hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger timber store. 

Gaston is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gaston who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Viddy

texts.en:
Viddy is a 36-year-old woman married to Daniel, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Viddy has been running a restaurant for a period of four years, earning herself an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Viddy was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor and is now servicing her first loan of KES. 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and potatoes to add to her current stock.

Viddy plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat and potatoes.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 42 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his store, which sells sugar, salt, soap, detergent, posho, and millet flour. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more goods for sale, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and increase family income. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to start another line of business. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his general store

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a resident in Bosamaro-Chache village. He stays with his lovely wife and 5 children on his 1.5 acre farmland. Andrew begun farming almost the same time he tied the knot with Gladys 15 years ago. He has grown the farm over the years to the point of stability and profitability where it is today. 
He chose to practise mixed-farming in order to manage business risks. On the farm, he keeps poultry, goats, and also grows tea. 
 
Andrew is seeking a loan to purchase a water tank. This asset will enable him store water during rainy seasons to be used during dry seasons. It will also enable him to fetch and store huge volumes of water at a go and use it overtime. 

Your loan will be of great impact to Andrew's livelihood since his work in farming will be made much easier. The time saved by having a water tank in place will help him focus on other income generating activities that will enable him to make enough income to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyn is 43 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Evalyn has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Evalyn has requested a loan of  Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy curtains, bed sheets, and pillows, and will help Evalyn to generate greater profits and increase family income. Evalyn hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big shop. 

Evalyn is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Evalyn who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy curtains, bed sheets, and pillows for resale

loans.name: Nery Francisca

texts.es:
Nery es comerciante, tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas desde hace mucho tiempo, aprendió de sus padres que se dedicaban a la misma actividad, también administra un comedor que pertenece a su abuela que está a 15 minutos caminando desde su casa. Nery vende pupusas los sábados y domingos de 3:00 pm a 7:00 pm.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar quesillo, maíz, chicharon, loroco, frijoles, repollo vinagre y demás. Nery sueña mejorar el local donde tiene su negocio y con los frutos de su trabajo dar el estudio a sus hijas.
texts.en: Nery is a saleswoman. She has had a business selling pupusas (stuffed tortillas) for a long time. She learned it from her parents who worked doing this same job. She also manages a diner that belongs to her grandmother, which is 15 minutes away by foot from her house. Nery sells pupusas on Saturdays and Sundays from 3:00 pm to 7:00 pm. She will use the loan to buy fresh cheese, corn, fried pork, loroco (edible flowers), beans, cabbage, vinegar and other ingredients. Nery dreams of improving the place where she has her business and with the fruit of her work, give an education to her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, corn, fried pork, loroco (edible flowers), beans, cabbage, vinegar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 47 años se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería oficio que aprendió de su padre, su estudios culminaron hasta sexto grado, su familia esta conformada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos y sus hijos le ayudan a sembrar y al cuido del ganado.

Juan se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para ordeñar las vacas después se va trabajar durante la mañana junto a sus hijos en la parcela que alquila y durante el resto del día cuida sus animales.

	El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que le generara una mayor producción de leche que le ayudara al incremento de sus ingresos. 

Juan planea en un futuro  con ayuda de otro crédito poder comprar un vehículo y empezara a realizar viajes para obtener un ingreso adicional y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juan is 47 years old and is dedicated to agriculture and cattle-raising, a skill he learned from his father. His studies culminated at the sixth grade. Juan's family is composed of his wife, who helps by doing domestic tasks, and his children who help with the planting and caring for the cattle.

Juan rises at 4:30 am to milk. Afterwards, he goes to work during the morning, together with his children, in the parcel they rent. During the rest of the day, he cares for his animals.

The loan he is requesting is to purchase a cow that will generate greater milk production, which will help increase their income.

Juan plans on a future aided by other loans so that he can purchase a vehicle and begin to make trips to obtain additional income, and to be able to offer a better education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a cow that will generate increased milk production and help expand his income.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children; neither are currently in school. For the past 9 years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her clinic. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy medicines, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and improve standards of living. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a hospital. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her clinic

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Alex has been working hard to manage his timber sales business. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Alex to generate greater profits and boost the business. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the growth. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 20 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her brick laying business, which lays bricks. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a Ugandan shillings loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy firewood, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and increase her family income. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the brick business. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Monic

texts.en:
Monic is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Monic has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which sells sugar, salt, pampers, plates, glasses, and soap. 

To help expand her business, Monic has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more grocery items, and will help Monic to generate greater profits and expand her business. Monic hopes that in the future she will be able to start another line of business. 

Monic is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Monic who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. For the past 3 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her poultry rearing business. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry chicks, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a farm. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more poultry chicks

loans.name: 95 United Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Francis, a member of 95 United Self Help Group in Limuru, Kenya. He is 32 years old, married and a father of two children. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's trainings, which have helped him realize his strengths in business. 

He earns a living by engaging himself in vegetable farming of carrots, kale, cabbages and potatoes, and in dairy farming. He wants a loan to boost his farming by buying fertilizer and planting seeds. He believes that this will help him increase his profits and provide quality education to his children, as well as meeting the basic needs for the family.

Francis is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married. They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food. 

She has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of Kes 30,000 to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Patrick. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training on financial management and enterprise development. He has benefited from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training through acquisition of entrepreneurial and financial management skills.

Patrick is sixty four years old, married and living with his wife and his four children. He is a vegetable farmer who raises kales, spinach and carrots and also does dairy farming. He is borrowing money to buy seeds and fodder for his cows. He hopes that this will give him better returns and provide for his family and be in a position to educate his children.

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support

loans.use: To buy planting seeds and fodder.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past eight years, Irene has been working hard to manage and operate her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, posho (maize meal), bananas and beans, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and increase her family income. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger restaurant. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, posho, bananas and beans

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Jacqueline has been working hard to manage her timber sales business. 

To help expand her business, Jacqueline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more timber, and will help Jacqueline to generate greater profits and boost the business. Jacqueline hopes that in the future she will be able to become a big supplier. 

Jacqueline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacqueline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soil for making bricks and to pay for labour

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 20 years, Iddi has been working hard to manage his butcher business, which sells meat. 

To help expand his business, Iddi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows, and will help Iddi to generate greater profits and expand the business. Iddi hopes that in the future he will be able to become a big supplier. 

Iddi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Iddi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows for his butcher business

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is 45 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Janepher has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Janepher has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Janepher to generate greater profits and expand the business. Janepher hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her welfare. 

Janepher is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Janepher who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 40 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past 12 years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her shoe sales business, in which she sells shoes and garments. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and garments, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and boost the business. Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business and stock. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Prossy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and garments

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Zeddy. She is a mother of 3 with a deeply engraved passion in dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 10 years. She owns a small farm in Roret village which is situated in Litein area of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her family. As a result, Zeddy has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her hardworking handsome husband, Zeddy also rears poultry and grows maize, amongst other crops. 

Zeddy is seeking a loan of KES 35,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favorable environment for the cows. With your loan, Zeddy has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labour in any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agri-business.

loans.use: To construct a cowshed for her farm

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, especially during the rainy season when it becomes hard to operate. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts to repair it. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates.

loans.use: to service her motorcycle and purchase new spare parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and improve her well-being. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Beera Agricultural Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Peter, a member of Beera Agricultural Self Help Group. The group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2011 and benefited from training on enterprise management and value addition skills. Peter is fifty years old, married and blessed with two children.

Peter does vegetable farming of carrots, onions, tomatoes, kales and cabbages. He wants to expand his farming though constrained financially. It’s for this reason that he is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizer and planting seeds to achieve his plans.  He strongly believes this will help him increase his level of income and as a result manage to pay school fees for the children.

Peter is very thankful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for acrylic paint and infrastructure for printing

loans.name: Sarah

Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her salon, which deals in hair dressings. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids and hair weaves. It will help Sarah to generate greater profits and improve her welfare. 

Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big salon. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase braids, and hair weaves.

loans.name: Rosa Aminta

texts.es:
Rosa de 50 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 7 hijos la  menor de 14 años de edad estudia 9° de educación básica, los otros 6 son mayores de edad y con hogar aparte. Rosa solo estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, con ella solo vive su hija menor.

Rosa es comerciante, compra cerdos de engorde, los hace ganar peso y luego los vende, y de las ganancias compra lo que necesita en su casa y nuevos cerdos para volver a engordarlos.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 3 cerdos, concentrado y medicinas para desarrollarlos, con lo que le quede del préstamo comprar maíz y frijol para el consumo familiar. Rosa sueña con preparar a su hija académicamente y forme su familia para que pueda valerse por sí misma.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is a widow and has seven children. The youngest is 14 and in 9th grade, the other six are grown and live on their own. Rosa only finished 5th grade herself.

Rosa is a merchant. She buys pigs to fatten them up and later sells them. With the profits she buys household necessities and new pigs for raising.

She needs the loan to buy 3 pigs, concentrated feed and medicines to raise them. With the rest of the loan she will buy corn and beans for her family to eat.

Rosa dreams of her daughter having a good academic foundation and forming a good family so that she can look after herself.

loans.use: to buy 3 pigs, concentrated feed and medicine to raise them.

loans.name: Abubaker

texts.en:
Abubaker is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mityana in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Abubaker has been working hard to manage his agriculture business which sells agriculture chemicals. 

To help expand his business, Abubaker has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agricultural chemicals and it will help Abubaker to generate greater profits and increase his income. 

Abubaker hopes that in the future he will be able to have a mini super market. 

Abubaker is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abubaker who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm

loans.name: Fred

Fred is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fred who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.
