loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another sewing machine as well as sewing materials in order to achieve a lot of work in a small amount of time.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan; she is twenty-seven years old. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. 

She is a farmer who does vegetable farming of indigenous kales, spinach, broccoli and tomatoes. She is borrowing money from Kiva to boost her farming by buying planting seeds and fertilizer. She hopes this will increase her profits so that she can be able to take care of her family needs such as food and clothing.

Susan is very happy with Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Zeka Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Jane, twenty-eight years old, married and a mother of one child. She is a member of Zeka Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise and financial management. She earns her living by operating a hair salon. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her business by adding more stock of shampoo, hair gel and weave so that she can be able to meet her customers' rising demand for her services. She looks forward to improved income, thus to be in a position to take care of the family's daily needs and support her child’s education.

Jane is very thankful to Kiva and all their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To add more stock of shampoo, hair gel and weave in her hair salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment, materials and uniforms for events.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to shop for jewelry and accessories

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
Rosa de 74 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos que viven en el extranjero. Rosa no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, trabaja en un pequeño comedor con su nieta, con ella solo vive su nieta y dos bisnietos, ella es la que mantiene el hogar.

Rosa es comerciante, vede comida todos los días en su casa, tiene 10 años trabajando de esta manera, aprendió con su madre. Hoy ella le transmite este conocimiento a su nieta, aprovechando la llegada de los turistas a la playa, también vende comida típica.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar láminas para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y hoja de palma para mejorar el techo del rancho que tiene a orilla de la playa. Rosa espera Dios le preste vida para preparar académicamente a su nieta.
texts.en:
Rosa, 74, is a widow and has two children who live outside the country. She lives with her granddaughter and two great-grandchildren. Rosa wasn't never able to attend school.

She works in a small restaurant with her granddaughter and that is what supports the home. She has been selling food from her home every day for 10 years, a trade she learned from her mother. Now she is passing on this knowledge to her granddaughter.

She takes advantage of the tourists who come to the beach, selling typical local dishes. The loan will be used to buy tiles for the roof of her home and palm fronds for the shack she has on the edge of the beach. Rosa hopes that God will continue to give her life so that she can help her granddaughter get through school.

loans.use: to buy shingles to change the roof on her home, and palm leaves to improve the roof of the shack she has on the edge of the beach.

loans.name: John

texts.en:

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, curry powder, bread, and cooking oil, and will help John to generate greater profits and buy land. John hopes that in the future he will be able to have rental houses. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his general store

The person raising his hand in the photo is called Caleb, a member of the group. He is 46 years old, married, blessed with three children and is living with all of them. He does vegetable farming and raises tomatoes and onions.

He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. This will greatly help in boosting his income, making him meet the family needs with ease.

He is grateful to Kiva and the entire lenders for the financial support.

loans.name: Cinia Elizabett

texts.es:
Cinia de 25 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de pollos, sus estudios culminaron hasta noveno grado, ella creció con su su madre quien le enseño esta actividad.  Su familia esta conformada  por su esposo quien le apoya trabajando en construcción y un hijo que van a la escuela.  

Cinia se dedica a la crianza y comercio de pollo de engorde actividad que realiza en el mercado de la ciudad y en los alrededores de su vivienda. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar pollos, vitaminas y concentrado.  Para ampliar su producción de pollos ya que viene la temporada donde hay mayor demanda.  

Cinia planea que con los ingresos que obtiene  de la venta de pollos y con ayuda de su esposo  piensa en futuro construir una vivienda digna para sus hijos ya que actualmente es de lamina.
texts.en:
Cinia, 25, raises and sells chickens. She grew up with her mother who taught her this trade. She went to school until 9th grade. Her family is made up of her husband, who works in construction to support her, and one school-aged son.

Cinia fattens chickens to sell in the market of her city and the neighborhood around her home. She asks for a loan to buy chickens, vitamins and concentrated feed so that she can increase her production during this season of higher demand. Cinia thinks that with the income from the chicken sales and the help of her husband, they will one day be able to build a solid home for their children. Their current home is made of tin sheeting.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins and concentrated feed to increase her production of chickens in the season of high demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase eight sheep for fattening and resale, in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ladrillo de piso, comprar puertas y ventanas para su casa y vivir más cómoda y segura con su familia. Santos sueña con ver su casa totalmente remodelada y a sus hijos preparados académicamente.
texts.en: This loan will be used to buy floor tiles, doors and windows for her home so that her family can live more comfortably and securely. Santos dreams of seeing her house totally remodeled and of her children getting a good education.

loans.use: to buy floor tiles, doors and windows for her home.

loans.name: Areng

texts.en: The lady in the photo is Areng, 58 years old, married and a mother of seven. She lives with her extended family. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training courses on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She needs a loan to buy quality fertilizer, storage sacks and other farm inputs. This will help her increase her harvest and consequently increase her level of income. She will, therefore, be able to support her family needs such as food. Areng is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and storage sacks.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2012, est constitué de 23 membres qui habitent tous dans le même village. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Sira ,se trouvant assis a droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette. Elle est mariée et mére de deux garçons.Elle est agée de 25 ans et elle pratique le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter un carton de thé a 8500f,un sceau de patte d'arachide a 16000f, dix kilos de sucre 12000f, dix litres d'huile de palme a 11000f et dix litres d'huile a 12000f.

Avec son bénéfice, elle compte subvenir aux besoins de ces enfants et aussi augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group, created in December 2012, is composed of 23 members who all live in the same village. Their main work involves commerce. 

Sira, who is sitting at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is a married mother of two boys. She is 25 years old and works in commerce as her main activity. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase a box of tea at 8,500 francs, a pail of peanut butter at 16,000 francs, 10 kg of sugar at 12,000 francs, 10 liters of palm oil at 11,000 francs, and 10 liters of oil at 12,000 francs. 

With her profits, she plans on supporting her children and also augmenting her savings.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to resell, such as tea, sugar, peanut butter, and oil.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 27 years old and lives in the town of Kinobi in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has no children. For the past three years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells posho (ground maize), rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, cooking oil, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and complete residential houses. Godfrey hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy posho, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread and cooking oil.

loans.name: Kamissa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis Décembre 2011, est constitué de 12 membres qui habitent tous dans le même village.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Fenda qui se trouve debout a droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette.   Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon et deux filles. Elle pratique le commerce comme activité principale.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter un sac d'oignon a 10000f,un sac de niébé a 13000f,deux sceaux de patte d'arachide a 20000f et 7000f pour les frais de transport.

Pour son bénéfice, elle compte en utiliser pour aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et a la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created in December 2011, is composed of 12 members who all live in the same village. Their main work involves commerce. 

Fenda, who is standing at the right in the photo with an arm raised, is our featured borrower. She is a married mother of three children (a boy and 2 girls). She works in commerce as her main activity. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase a sack of onions at 10,000 francs, a sack of black-eye peas at 13,000 francs, and 2 pails of peanut butter at 20,000 francs. And she will spend 7,000 francs on transportation costs. 

With her profits, she plans helping out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses and the children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to resell such as onions, peanut butter, and black-eye peas.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 37 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past six years, Anita has been working hard to manage her small fish business, which sells smoked fish. 

To help expand her business, Anita has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more smoked fish, and will help Anita to generate greater profits and take care of her family's basic needs. Anita hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Anita is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Anita who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more smoked fish

loans.name: Asheeri

texts.en:
Asheeri is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Asheeri has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, cooking oil, posho (maize meal) and toilet paper. 

To help expand his business, Asheeri has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, cooking oil, posho and toilet paper, and will help Asheeri to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Asheeri hopes that in the future he will be able to construct rental houses. 

Asheeri is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Asheeri who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, salt, sodas, bananas, bread, cooking oil, posho and toilet paper

loans.name: Leonox

texts.en:
Leonox is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, with five of them currently in school. For the past one year, Leonox has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soda and beer. 

To help expand his business, Leonox has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more crates of soda and beer, and will help Leonox to generate greater profits and expand the business. Leonox hopes that in the future he will be able to earn more profits. 

Leonox is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Leonox who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Harriet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells batteries, juice, books and pencils. 

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy batteries, juice, books and pencils, and will help Harriet to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Harriet hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another piece of land. 

Harriet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Harriet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy batteries, juice, books and pencils

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан 34 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. Старшему сыну 18 лет, младшему 5 лет. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. У Уулкан высшее педагогическое образование, работает учителем в младших классах. В качестве дополнительного источника доходов для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 2000 году с 6,000 сом (KGS). Хозяйство на сегодня приносит в среднем 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц в основном от продажи экологически чистого, вкусного молока. На данный момент в хозяйстве Уулкан имеется 7 коров. Также на 0,56 ГА земли, она выращивает лук и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en: Uulkan is 34, married, and a mother of four children.  Her oldest son is 18, and her youngest son is 5.  Her husband and children are quite obliging when she needs some help around the house.  Uulkan has a background in education and works as a schoolteacher; she also grows crops and raises livestock to earn some extra money for her family, first starting in 2000 with 6,000 som worth of capital.  Her farm consists of 7 cows as well as 0.56 hectares of land for growing onions and corn, and currently brings in 17,000 som per month on average from selling tasty organic milk.  To further develop her business, Uulkan is seeking a loan of 90,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy some more dairy cows, and plans on using any profits due to the loan to continue to add more animals to her farm.

loans.use: buy additional dairy cows to increase organic milk sales

loans.name: Ramatoulaye's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village est créé le 01 décembre 2009  a en ses actifs huit cycles dans le programme. Il est composé de femmes très dynamiques et désireuses d’améliorer leurs conditions socio économiques. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs décennies, elles un bon esprit de groupe caractérisé par la solidarité. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluies.

Madame Mariama (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle âgée de 30 ans, est mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles et deux garçons. Elle est commerçante.
 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va s’approvisionner en huile 20 litres à 18000F, en tomate 3 kilos à 3000F et de l oignon à 7000  qu’elle revendra par pot  de 65 et 100 F CFA.

 Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront de mieux prendre en charge sa famille en améliorant l’alimentation  et accroître son épargne pour prétendre à un crédit plus important dans le futur.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was created December 1, 2009, and has already been through eight loan cycles. It is composed of very dynamic women who want to improve their socioeconomic conditions. They have all lived in the same village for several decades, and they have good team spirit characterized by solidarity. Their main activity is small retail businesses along with farming during the rainy season.

Mrs. Mariama (seated on the far right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is a 30-year-old mother of four children: two girls and two boys. She is a retail merchant.

She will use this new loan to resupply with 20 liters of oil for 18,000 francs, 3 kilos of tomatoes for 3,000 francs, and 7,000 francs' worth of onions she will resell in pots of 65 and 100 CFA francs.

The profits resulting from these activities will enable her to better support her family by improving their nutrition, and increase her savings so she can qualify for a larger loan in the future.

loans.use: buy 20 liters of oil for 18,000 francs, 3 kilos of tomatoes for 3,000 francs, and 7,000 francs' worth of onions she will resell in pots of 65 and 100 CFA francs.

loans.name: Anah

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Anah. She is a smallholder farmer from Kitale, a rural town known for maize farming and poultry production. Anah has a husband and at home they have eight children. For the last four years Anah has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her main income sources include milk, eggs and maize. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled her to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. 

Anah is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Additional poultry in her farm will bring her untold joy, and will also boost the egg production thus increasing sales volume. Anah needs to increase her income to take care of the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and boost egg production.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Bosamaro Masaba village, located on the outskirts of Nyamira town, Kenya. Locals in this area mostly practise farming for a living. James is no different. He has spent 30 years of his life growing tea and keeping dairy animals. He spends the income from milk, tea and other side businesses to provide for his family of eight children.
 
James stated that he appreciates the fact that his dairy business is profitable and sustainable. He intends to expand it but he lacks the funds necessary for it. He is appealing to Kiva lenders to help him out with a KES 40,000 loan to construct a cowshed.

The cowshed James has in place is temporary and not very good in design and structure. With your loan however, he will be able to put up a decent shelter to protect his animals against harsh weather. The shelter will also facilitate introduction of zero-grazing in future. James told our loan officer that he expects an increase in milk production from this investment. The additional income will help him settle other farm expenses that are currently out of reach.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Agnes, a very hardworking, energetic young farmer. Although she has only farmed for the past five years, she is working hard and learning good farming practices. Through the profits she makes she has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents.

Agnes lives near Waitaluk in the Kitale area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill.

The Waitaluk area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. Agnes intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully breakdowns will be few and far between.

To accomplish this, Agnes is applying for a 40,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. Profits derived from the mill will be used to comfortably repay the loan. In the next two years, Agnes sees herself established and running more than one posho mill. She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an electric posho mill

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a businessman in the general market in Mbarara district. He is 59 years old and is happily married with eight children. He never went to school because he never was able to pay school fees due to the humble background from which he comes.

Despite the fact that he never went to school, he has been borrowing from UGAFODE for the last six years and is thankful that he has been able to stabilize his business along with educating his rather many children and dependents who are his elder brother’s children in secondary school. He rents a room from where he operates the business which supports his family. The business would be profitable but most of the profits are taken by the family expenses.

Day by day competition is very high and at times he is forced to borrow money from UGAFODE micro finance.

He has now applied for loan of 5 million UGX to add stock in the business. He thinks this is a stepping stone to a better future. He is thankful to UGAFODE and Kiva lenders for partnering with him on his journey to financial freedom.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise in the form of sugar, flour and cooking oil among other items.

loans.name: Ronalie

texts.en:
Ronalie owns a retail store within her locality. She has been running her store for 15 years and her transportation business for four years. Her spouse works as a farmer and driver. Ronalie is 45 years old and has three children. Her youngest child is still attending school. Ronalie is thankful for her previous loan because it helped her a lot, especially in increasing her income.

Now, she wants to keep her retail store profitable. That's why she is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP. Her requested loan will be use to buy grocery items and gasoline for resale. She believes that she can maintain her retail store and transportation business through continuous access to financial assistance from lenders.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and gasoline for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Esther started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Roret, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of four children sells milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart. Every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. 

She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax and also protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Esther believes that, with this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Esther waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Shalon Group

texts.en:
These five members, led by Hannah as the representative, are part of the group called Shalon. The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling groceries and general goods, pedicure services and sewing services. They will need a total amount of 7,900 GHS to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesspersons. 

Hannah says that she joined ID Ghana five years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her ninth loan request with ID Ghana. She currently has a business selling groceries. Hannah will use her part of this loan (3,000 GHS) to increase her capital. She will buy sugar, rice, biscuits and canned products to sell to customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family. Hannah is 42 years old, married and has four children. When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Hannah replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, biscuits and canned products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Biakoye and they are on their ninth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The businesses run by the members include clothing, fry yam and fish and electrical accessories. The loan that they will receive will benefit micro businesses like Mercy's. This is Mercy's ninth year with ID-Ghana. She joined after a friend, who is a member of the institution, invited her.

Mercy currently has a business selling ready-made clothing. She began this business through a friend, who showed her how to acquire and sell this product. The loan that she has requested is to increase her working capital so that she can purchase more ready-made clothing to sell to customers. She will purchase the product from the wholesalers and later sell it at the market. This job allows her to generate income to support her family. She is 28 years old, single and still living with her parent. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the other members of the group because they are kind.

loans.use: To purchase more ready-made clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mbuni Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 32 years old and has two sons who are in school. She is not married and until now, she has been supporting her family by running two businesses. Her first project is a bar selling beers, soft drinks and spirits and the second is a business selling fish oil. Tatu has been in these businesses for five years now, working from 7am until midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, she has had more more than three credit requests. This one is to be apportioned among Mbuni, a five-member group. She has paid back her previous loans successfully. Tatu used the previous credits to buy a freezer, tables and chairs and drinks for her bar. She managed to receive extra income that she used to cover her family's household and school fees. In the coming years, she would like to be successful in her businesses.

With her new loan request, Tatu will invest her portion to buy stocks of beers, sodas, water and spirits and fish oil to resell.

loans.use: to buy stock of beer, sodas, water, spirits and fish oil to resell.

loans.name: Songa Mbele Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Mwahoja, who is in her mid-30s, is single with two children who are still in school. She has been selling fish for eight years now.  She works from 10 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwahoja's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her stock of fish and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her stock of fish and meet customer demand.

Mwahoja will share this loan with her loan group, Songa Mbele Ukonga, which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael cultivates his 6,000 square meters of rice farmland. He also offers charcoal that serves as an additional source of income for his family. Michael would like to keep his rice farmland productive and make his charcoal sales business profitable. That's why he is seeking financial assistance. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP. He will use this loan to purchase a variety of seeds and fertilizer for his farming and sacks of charcoals to sell. He hopes to obtain the loan amount he requested for continuous smooth flow in his farming and charcoal sales business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds and fertilizer for his rice farming and sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín de 22 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura  oficio que aprendió de sus padres, sus estudios culminaron hasta bachillerato, su familia esta formada  por su esposa quien le apoya con los oficios domésticos. 

Benjamín se levanta a las 5:30 a.m. para irse a trabajar durante la mañana en el terreno que alquila y durante el resto del día  se dedica a vender productos lácteos como crema, queso, quesillo, etc. En los alrededores y en los cantones aledaños para obtener ingresos.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más queso, crema, requesón, quesillo, guajada, para fortalecer el negocio que posee ya que desea ir a otros lugares a ofrecer sus productos para hacer crecer su negocio.

Benjamín planea en un futuro con ayuda de otro crédito, poder comprar un vehículo para llevar con más facilidad sus productos,  ya que actualmente lo hace con una motocicleta y no puede llevar mucho lo que hace que sus ingresos disminuyan.
texts.en:
Benjamin, 22, works in agriculture, a trade he learned from his parents.  He has a high school education and a wife who is a homemaker.

Benjamin gets up at 5:30 a.m. to go work on land he rents.  The rest of the day he sells dairy products such as cream, cheese, curd, etc. in surrounding areas and rural communities in order to earn extra income.

The loan he is requesting is to buy more cheese, cream, cottage cream and curd to strengthen the business he has.  He wants to begin offering his products in other areas to expand his business.

In the future and with the help of another loan, Benjamin plans to buy a vehicle to transport his products more easily.  Right now he uses a motorcycle and is unable to carry very much which limits his income.

loans.use: To buy more cheese, cream, cottage cheese, and curd to strengthen his business.

loans.name: Embassy Group

texts.en:
Daniel, a 44-year-old man, is married and known to be a good businessman.  He runs a genge selling fruits, vegetables and other small shop items, a business he has been doing for six years now.  Before, he has been managing one genge but after the Kiva support, he opened another genge and improved the current one.  He is so happy and thankful with everyone who has supported his group. Daniel operates his business from 6:30 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his third credit request and it is to be apportioned among Embassy's two-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. He used the previous loans, paid back successfully, to restock his genge with fruits and vegetables. Daniel managed to open another genge and he appreciate Kiva’s support because of the benefit he has seen to his project.  He earned a profit, which he used to cover household expenses and plow back into his project to grow.
 
With his new credit request, Daniel will buy more stocks for his new operating branch. He want to improve it to be like the other one.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his new operating branch and improve it to be like the other one.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old and married with four children. With one of her children in school, Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

Lolita has been in this business for 14 years. 

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Noong Het 9 Group

texts.en:
Xuan, a widowed Thai woman, is the mother of two children and lives in a new small Thai traditional house with her son and her niece while her daughter works as a teacher in another remote village. Without being trained for specific technical skills, Xuan relies only on her experience at farming as she has worked at cultivating and breeding since she was a little girl. Indeed, agricultural production is the main source of income for her family. To cover living expenses, she has diversified farming work into different activities, such as growing rice, raising pigs, fish, chickens and ducks. However, when her husband alive, he sold a part of the land for the rice field due to his illness. For that reason, to have enough land for cultivation, she has taken out her fifth loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to have enough cash to buy additional land. 

Though there are plenty of diseases occurring with rice, Xuan believes that she will overcome the difficulties with the support of the agricultural workers of Anh Chi Em, and then she can improve significantly the earnings for her family and buy some new furniture for the house. 

In the picture, Xuan wears the blue shirt and stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy additional land for cultivation

loans.name: Safiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place lors de l’inauguration du banc villageois courant deuxième semestre 2013. Ce groupe est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide été elles vivent dans le même quartier depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Kadiatou  (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, est mariée et mère de 01 garçons et 05 filles qui ont atteint la majorité. Cependant malgré son âge avancé elle demeure une femme très dynamique. Elle s’active dans la préparation de jus qu’elle vend dans le quartier et les quartiers aux alentours. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter cinq sacs de pain de singe, 10 bassines de bissap à 50000 F et du sucre à 20000F, autres ingrédients pour la préparation du jus.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille surtout sur le plan culinaire.
texts.en:
The group was established at the inauguration of the "banc villageois" loan group, in the second half of 2013. This group consists of very dynamic women who share strong bonds of solidarity and mutual aid, and have lived in the same neighborhood for many years. Their main activity is small business.

Mrs. Kadiatou (seated at the right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is a 45-year-old married mother of one boy and five girls who have reached adulthood. Despite her advanced age she is still a very dynamic woman. She is active in preparing juices she sells in the neighborhood and the surrounding area. She has good experience in this field, having practiced it for many years.

She intends to use the new loan to buy five bags of baobab fruit, 10 basins of bissap (flavored with hibiscus flowers) for 50,000 francs, sugar for 20,000 francs, and other ingredients used in the preparation of juices

Business profits will enable her to better contribute towards improving her family's living conditions, particularly regarding nutrition.

loans.use: buy five bags of baobab fruit, 10 basins of bissap for 50,000 francs, sugar for 20,000 francs, and other ingredients used in the preparation of juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, gravel, brick, iron and metal sheeting to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to strengthen the walls of her house and replace the locks on her door.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel de 35 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y al transporte de carga. sus estudios culminaron hasta el bachillerato, él creció con sus padres.

Manuel se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a trabajar durante la mañana en el terreno que alquila y durante el resto del día trabaja realizando viajes de carga. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres vacas que le ayudaran a  iniciar una producción de leche para empezar a elaborar lácteos como queso, crema, requesón, etc. y que su esposa venderá entre los vecinos y en los alrededores.

Manuel planea en un futuro  con ayuda de otro crédito comprar más vacas para producir más leche y ampliar el negocio para incrementar sus ingresos
texts.en:
Manuel is 35 years old and makes a living in farming and in cargo transport. He completed high school and was brought up by his parents.

Manuel wakes up at 4am in order to work in the morning at the land that he rents. He spends the rest of the days working as a cargo driver.

This loan will be used to buy three cows to start producing milk and begin making dairy products such as cheese, cottage cheese, cream and more. Manuel's wife will sell these goods to neighbours and in the surrounding area.

In the future Manuel plans to use another loan to buy more cows, produce more milk and expand his business in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy three cows to start producing milk and begin making dairy products such as cheese, cottage cheese, cream and more.

loans.name: Sandra Azucena

texts.es:
Sandra  de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta 7º grado por situación económica abandono la escuela, es madre soltera y tiene 8 hijos; pero solo 3 viven con ella los demás ya se acompañaron.

Sandra siempre ha trabajado en el campo, en la agricultura pues desde pequeña su tío con quien se crio la llevaba a trabajar a la  milpa, pues no conoció a su padre la abandono cuando su mamá estaba embarazada.  Ella cuenta que le toco lo mismo pues  su compañero la abandono hace 10 años y le a tocado sacar a sus hijos adelante sola.

 Ella siembra con sus hijos maíz, frijol, maicillo también le gusta la crianza de ganado, pues tiene una vaca la cual le a dado la comida para sus hijos, ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m pues donde siembra esta como a un kilómetro y medio y como es loma hay que caminar a pie. Luego trabaja 6 horas y regresa para atender a su hogar 


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla y otra parte para comprar maicillo.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos graduarse, construir una casa de ladrillo, hoy es de adobe
Y comprarse una 3 vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
Sandra is 49 years old, she studied until seventh grade but had to abandon school for economic reasons. She is a single mother and has 8 children, although only three of them still live with her as the rest now live with their partners. 

Since she was small and her uncle, who raised her, took her to work in the cornfield, Sandra has always worked in the fields and in farming. She never knew her father who abandoned her when her mother was pregnant. She says that the same thing happened to her when her partner abandoned her 10 years ago and she was left to raise her children on her own.

With her children she plants corn, beans, sorghum and she also likes to raise livestock and she has a cow that has helped feed her children. She gets up at 4:30 a.m. because where she plants her crops is a kilometre and a half away and she has to walk because it is on a small hill. She works for six hours and then returns to take care of her home. 

The loan that she is asking for is to purchase a heifer and to buy sorghum.

Her dream is to see her children graduate, to build a brick house (the current one is made from mud bricks), and to buy 3 dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer and to buy sorghum.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción de 44 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 2 hijas y un hijo, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero gracias a un programa de alfabetización que llegó a su comunidad pudo aprender a escribir y a leer un poco. De ella únicamente depende una hija.

Concepción cultiva la tierra, tiene más de 20 años de experiencia, su esposo era agricultor y cuando murió ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de los cultivos de maíz y frijol, también se encargó del negocio de compra y venta de cerdos para mantenerlo estable.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar concentrado para unos cerdos que tiene y para comprar un par de cerdos de engorde más, Concepción sueña ver crecer a sus nietos algún día.
texts.en:
Concepción is 44 years old and is a widow with 2 daughters and one son. She did not have the opportunity to study, but thanks to a literacy programme which came to her community she was able to learn to read and write a little. One of her daughters depends solely on her.

Concepción farms land, in which she has more than 20 years experience. Her husband was a farmer and when he died she had to take charge of the corn and bean crops. She also took charge of keeping the business buying and selling pigs stable.

She needs the loan to buy concentrated feed for the pigs that she has, and to buy a couple more pigs to fatten. Concepción dreams of bringing up grandchildren some day.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for the pigs that she has, and to buy a couple more pigs to fatten.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kigumba in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is a widow and has eight children. For the past three years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her furniture shop, where various furniture types are made.

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock by buying more timber, pine wood and other materials, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and to have enough supplies for the market. Josephine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Josephine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying more timber, pine wood and other materials

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Auxiliadora es una mujer laboriosa y tiene la edad de 59 años de edad, casado. Ella se dedica a la compra - venta de productos de belleza y ropa en su domicilio desde hace 12 años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de perfumes, vanidades, sombras de ojos, cremas corporales, camisetas, blusas, pantalones, etc. La clienta lleva diez ciclos trabajando con la institución y ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y responsable en los días de pagos.
texts.en: Auxiliadora is a hardworking woman. She is 59 years old and married. She has worked buying and selling beauty products and clothing in her home. She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, vanities, eye shadows, body creams, t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc. The member has had ten loan cycles with the institution and she has shown to be a hardworking and responsible person in making her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, vanities, eye shadows, body creams, t-shirts, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Denny Jeovany

texts.es:
Denny de 21 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos, solo pudo estudiar hasta 4°grado de educación básica, su esposa además de ser ama de casa, también comercia con ropa, solo sus hijos dependen de él.

Denny es comerciante, vende artículos religiosos, collares, pulseras y más, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, aprendió con sus abuelos. También es agricultor y en esta labor lo apoya su esposa. Necesita el préstamo para comprar collares, pulseras, camándulas, escapularios, broches y demás para preparar su negocio para la temporada que se acerca.

Denny espera le resulte la inversión y mantener estable las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
Denny, 21, is married and has two children. He could only study up to the fourth grade of primary school due to his family’s financial situation. His wife works as a housewife and sells clothes. Only his children depend on him.

Denny is a businessman. He sells religious articles, such as necklaces and bracelets. He has been doing this for three years, taught by his grandparents. He also works in agriculture and his wife helps him.

Denny needs a loan to buy necklaces, bracelets, devotional scapulars, brooches and other articles in order to be ready for the upcoming season. He hopes to make a good investment and keep his sales stable.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, bracelets, rosaries, devotional scapulars, brooches, etc.

loans.name: Jimmy Wilmer

texts.es:
Jimmy es un joven muy alegre y entusiasta, su pasión es la música es por ello que trabaja como DJ en una Discoteca de su ciudad natal, Ica. También está estudiando la carrera de Ciencias de la Comunicación en una Universidad. Él diariamente se esfuerza mucho en sus clases y su trabajo porque quiere convertirse en una persona exitosa y sobre todo porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia.
Jimmy está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una cama y un colchón para poder tener noches más tranquilas, ya que el colchón que tiene está deteriorado y no duerme bien. Con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y así más adelante podrá convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Jimmy is a joyful and enthusiastic young man. His passion for music led him to work as a DJ for a club in his hometown, Ica. He is also studying Communication Sciences at the university. Jimmy studies and works hard because he wants to become a successful person, but mostly because he wants to get ahead with his family.

Jimmy appreciates the help that Kiva lenders have given him. He will be able to buy a bed and a mattress to sleep better. The mattress he has is in bad shape, which affects his sleep. This will result in better living conditions for him, and he will be able to become a great professional.

loans.use: to buy a new mattress and a bed.

loans.name: Flor Esmeralda

texts.es:
Flor de 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos uno de 7 años de edad que estudia 3° grado de educación básica y una hija de 2 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado de educación básica, por lo que  tuvo que trabajar vendiendo pasteles, enchiladas y atol;  su esposo trabaja como albañil y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

Flor es comerciante, tiene 4 años de experiencia vendiendo productos de revista y por catálogo de una marca de cosméticos, por las tardes cuando llega de trabajar su esposo se encarga de los niños y ella sale a vender de manera ambulante y casa por casa. Trabaja todos los días de las 3:00 pm en adelante.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar maíz, papas, repollo vinagre, carne, aceite y demás para elaborar pasteles, enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, atol, entre otros.

Flor sueña con que algún día con esfuerzo de su trabajo y financiamiento pueda reparar el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Flor is 25 years old. She is married and has two children: a son who is 7 years old and is studying third grade of primary school, and a daughter who is 2. Because of a lack of financial resources, she only studied up to 6th grade of primary school. Therefore, she had to work selling pies, enchiladas and atol (hot drink). Her husband works as a construction worker, and only his children and him live with her. Flor is a saleswoman. She has four years of experience selling brand cosmetic products by catalog. In the afternoons, after her husband returns from work and takes care of the children, she goes selling door to door. She works every day from 3:00 pm. on. She will use the loan to buy corn, potatoes, cabbage, vinegar, meat, oil and other ingredients to make pies, enchiladas, plantain tortillas (tostadas), atol, among other things. Flor dreams that some day, thanks to her effort and financing, she will be able to repair the roof of her house.

loans.use: to buy corn, potatoes, cabbage, vinegar, meat, oil and other ingredients to make pies, enchiladas, plantain tortillas (tostadas). atol (hot drink), among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 fryer chickens, concentrate and vitamins.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Maria Mercedes es una mujer emprendedora  exitosa tiene la edad de 40 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación para salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pólvoras desde hace diez años, el crédito lo solicita para la inversión en la compra de pólvoras como volcancitos, candelas de luces, bombitas, cachinflines, toros de fuegos, entre otros. Con el fin de satisfacer la demanda insatisfecha y mantener su negocio en temporadas altas.
texts.en: Maria Mercedes is a successful, entrepreneurial woman. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of two children for whom she wants to get ahead. She has bought and sold fireworks for ten years. She is asking for a loan to buy fireworks such as fountains, sparklers, smoke bombs, bottle rockets, fire bulls, and more. She is doing this to meet an unfulfilled demand and to matin her business in busy season.

loans.use: to invest in buying fireworks such as fountains, sparklers, smoke bombs and bottle rockets.

loans.name: Damari Magali

texts.es: Doña Damari es una mujer exitosa, emprendedora y tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada, y madre de dos hijos quienes son su deseo de superación para seguir adelante. Su negocio es la venta de prendas de plata desde hace dos años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de cadenas, anillos, pulseras, dijes bañados de plata, vitrinas, etc. La clienta lleva dos ciclos trabajando con la institución y ha demostrado ser una persona trabajadora y responsable las fechas de pago.
texts.en: Damari is a successful, entrepreneurial woman. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of two children for whom she wants to get ahead. Her business has been selling silver jewelry for two years. She is asking for the loan to buy chains, rings, bracelets, silver plated pendants, display cases, etc.   She has been working for two cycles with the institution and has shown herself to be hardworking and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: to buy chains, rings, bracelets, silver plated pendants, display cases, etc.

loans.name: Deyra Migdalia

texts.es: Doña Deyra es una mujer talentosa y muy trabajadora, tiene la edad de 26 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos; se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y perfumes Avon y Zermat. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de pacas de ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, sandalias de niñas(os), y adultos, y perfumes Avon y Zermat para damas y caballeros. La clienta lleva dos ciclos trabajando con la institución y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable.
texts.en: Deyra is a talented and hard-working woman. She is 26 years old, is in a relationship and is the mother of two children. She works selling clothing, sandals and Avon and Zermat perfumes. She will use the loan to buy bales of clothing like blouses, pants, shirts, sandals for adults and children, Avon and Zermat perfume and cologne. She has been working with the institution for two loan cycles and has proven herself to be a responsible person.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing like blouses, pants, shirts, sandals for adults and children, Avon and Zermat perfume and cologne.

loans.name: Lucia Guadalupe

texts.es: Lucia tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 18 años, 16 años y 6 años de edad. Lucia se gana la vida por medio de  la elaboración y venta de tortillas.  De esta forma junto a su compañero de vida quien es agricultor mantienen la economía del hogar.  Lucia desea construir un corredor a un lado de su vivienda para protegerse del sol y de las lluvias. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera, pines, etc.
texts.en: Lucia is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion and her three children aged 18, 16 and 6 years old. Lucia makes her living by making and selling tortillas. In this way together with her spouse who is a farmer, they support the household economy. Lucia wants to construct a veranda on one side of her house to protect them from the sun and the rain. So she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized laminate, wood and bolts, etc.

loans.use: to buy galvanized laminate, wood, bolts etc to build a veranda on her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone covers, headsets, keyboards, watches and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some machinery and equipment like a mixer and a kneader, and to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Luisita

texts.en:
Luisita is 45 years old and married, with seven children. With three children in school, Luisita works very hard to provide for them.

Luisita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items to sell, like groceries, etc..

Luisita has been in this business for 23 years. 

In the future, Luisita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of items to sell like groceries, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina works hard to support her family. Ma. Cristina is married, and has a buy and sell of cashew nuts business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

Ma. Cristina has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 32 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school; Joanne works very hard to provide for them.

Joanne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Joanne has been in this business for one year, and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, biscuits, candies, crackers, etc.. 

In the future, Joanne would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 57 years old and has 12 children. Loreta is a married woman, and has two children who are in school.

Loreta is in the agricultural business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loreta has been for one year now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Loreta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Luís Beltran

texts.es:
Luís de 52 años de edad, pescador artesanal. Trabajador y esmerado por sacar adelante a su familia.
Tiene una educación media, todo debido a la situacion económica que antes atravesaba su familia. Hoy en día el se dedica a pescar, profesión que le genera muy buenos ingresos a su hogar, ademas le permite llevar alimentos muy ricos en vitaminas a su familia.

 Luís quiere dar unos arreglos a su casa, quiere modificar algunas puertas, pintar y cambiar algunas laminas. Es por eso que ha solicitado un crédito, con el cual comprara laminas, pinturas, clavos, entre otros materiales que le hacen falta.

A futuro Luís desea ver su pequeña casa totalmente remodelada, vivir cómodamente él y su familia; dándoles así una protección y una seguridad en su casa.
texts.en:
Luís, age 52, is a fisherman.  He is hard-working and conscientious in order to get his family ahead.  He has a high school education because of the financial situation his family experienced.

He is now a fisherman, a profession that generates very good earnings for his household.  It also allows him to provide his family with food that is very rich in vitamins.

Luís wants to make some repairs to his house.  He wants to modify some doors and paint and change some metal sheeting.  That is why he has requested a loan.  He will use the loan to buy paint, nails, and other materials that he needs.

In the future Luís wishes to see his small house completely remodeled and for him and his family to live comfortably.  He will be giving them protection and security in their house.

loans.use: to buy paint, nails, and other materials.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 25 years old, married, and works hard to help her husband.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.  Leah is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy materials like a fishing net and for the maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like a fishing net and for the maintenance of her fishing

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice farming. Maricel is borrowing PHP10,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell via her business. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: José, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea del Municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, cerca de Peña Blanca. José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz y frijoles y hace 8 años que cultiva naranjas. Esta producción la vende en el mercado de la zona de donde obtiene los ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. Ha mantenido en buen estado la producción por la inversión de prestamos y ganancias. Actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo que es por 7.500 Lempiras, este dinero lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de maíz y frijol para siembra y compra de abono para el cultivo de naranja. Su plan es seguir con los cultivos, darle mejor asistencia para mejorar la producción y brindarle calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: José is 36 years old, is married and has three children. He lives in the Municipality of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, close to Peña Blanca. José has worked in agriculture growing corn and beans and has grown oranges for 8 years. He sells his product in the local market where he gets the income he needs to support his family. He has kept his crops in good condition by investing through loans and his profits. Currently he is requesting his 3rd loan which is for 7500 HNL. He will invest this money in the purchase of corn and bean seed to plant and to buy fertilizer for his orange crops. His plan is to continue with his crops, providing them with the best care to improve his production and provide his family with quality living.

loans.use: to buy improved corn and bean seed and buy fertilizer for his orange crops.

loans.name: Lucía Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucía nació en una comunidad llamada Kilambé en el año 1970. A la edad de dos años se mudó a otra comunidad llamada Sapote cum, ahi vivió por 8 años en una finca que tenía su padre, sin embargo despues se tuvo que mudar con su madre y sus hermanos a otra comunidad llamada el Chamarro ya que su padre abandonó a su madre y a sus 9 hermanos. Esto fue durante la epoca de la guerra civil en Nicaragua, Lucía recuerda que fue una epoca muy dura ya un grupo armado entró a la finca donde vivían y quemaron la casa. Años despues superaron esto, y hoy en día Lucía está casada con Francisco ellos tienen 5 hijos, ellos viven en una finca y siembran granos basicos y cortan café, lo que provee su fuente de ingresos. Lucía y su familia habitan en una comunidad donde no existe la energía electrica comercial, es por eso que la energía solar es la única solución para poder iluminarse y cargar su celular para comunicarse. Lucía desea adquirir un pequeño sistema solar para instalarlo en su casa y poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia was born in a community called Kilambé in 1970.  When she was two years old she moved to another community called Sapote.  She lived there for eight years on a farm that her father had.  However, she later had to move with her mother and her siblings to another community named Chamarro.  This is because her father abandoned her mother and her nine siblings.

This happened during the time of the civil war in Nicaragua.  Lucía remembers that it was a very hard time because an armed group entered the farm where she lived and burned the house.  Years later they overcame this.  Now Lucía is marred to Francisco and they have five children.  They live on a farm and grow basic grains and cut coffee, which provides their source of income.

Lucía and her family live in a community that does not have commercial energy.  That is why solar energy is the only solution to be able to have light and charge her cell phone in order to communicate.  Lucía wishes to install a small solar system at her house to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a resident from Ormoc, Leyte. She is a married woman and a mother of a two-year-old child. 

In order to make a living, Estrella has raised pigs for more than four years now. Her husband also provides an additional income through his carpentry job.

Estrella is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. With this, Estrella believes that she will be able to improve her hog-raising business. 

In the future, Estrella dreams of improving their way of living. She also wants to save money for the future schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.
